TRANSLATION.



1. Hail ! Prosperity ! The water-pots (kuṭa) of copper covered579 with gold,--which had been placed in the temple (kōyil) of Chaṇḍēśvara until the second year (of the reign) of[page 2-246] the lord Śrī-Rājēndra-Śōṛadēva by Ādittaṉ Sūryaṉ, alias Teṉṉavaṉ Mūvēnda-Vēḷāṉ, a headman (of) Poygai-nāḍu, who carried on the management of the temple of the lord Śrī-Rājarājēśvara,--were weighed by the stone called (after) Āḍavallāṉ, and engraved on stone (as follows):--
2. One water-pot of copper covered with gold, which had been placed in the temple of Chaṇḍēśvara, weighed three hundred and ninety-seven kaṛañju,--including five kaṛañju and a half, and two mañjāḍi of gold which was laid over (it).
3. One copper water-pot weighed four hundred and one kaṛañju,--including six kaṛañju and two mañjāḍi of gold which was laid over (it).
4. One copper water-pot weighed four hundred and five kaṛañju,--including five kaṛañju and three quarters of gold which was laid over (it).
5. One water-pot of copper which was covered with gold, weighed three hundred and eighty-five (kaṛañju,--including five kaṛañju and three quarters, two mañjāḍi and (one) kuṉṟi of gold which was laid over (it).


No. 61. ON THE WEST WALL OF THE BRIHANNAYAKI SHRINE.



This and the next inscription (No. 62) are engraved on the west wall of a shrine, which is situated on the north side of the large Nandi.580 No. 61 is dated on the 334th day of the 2nd year of the reign of a king, who styles himself Tribhuvanachakravartin Kōnēriṉmai-koṇḍāṉ. As I have shown in the introduction to No. 21 (page 110), this is not a proper name, but a title which is applied to various kings. The inscription records, that the king had built the shrine on which it is engraved, and which was called Ulagu-muṛudum-uḍaiya-Nāchchiyār, i.e., "the goddess who owns the whole world," within the Rājarājēśvara temple at Tañjāvūr, and that he presented to that shrine eleven vēli of land in the village of Koṭṭagarkkuḍi, alias Ulag-āṇḍa-nāyaki-nallūr. The second name, which means "the good village of the goddess who rules the world," was evidently bestowed on the village with reference to the goddess, to whose shrine it was given. The four boundaries of the land which had been granted, were to be marked with stones, on which a trident, the emblem of Śiva, was engraved581 (paragraph 6).


TEXT.



[1.] svasti SrI [||*] koTTakarkkuTiyA[n_a*] ulakANTanAyakinallUrkku ezutin_a tirumukappaTi [1*]
[2.] tribhuvan_accakrava[r]tti konerin_maikoNTAn_ tañcAvUr uTaiyAr SrIi- rAjarAjIzvara-
[3.] muTaiyAr koyililttAn_att[A*]rkku [2*] ikkoyilil nAm ezuntaruLu-vitta ulakumuzutum-
[4.] muTaiyanAcciyArkku amutupaTi uLLi[TTu*] veNTumav[ai*]yiRRukku582aru-mozu(te)te[va]-
[5.] vaLanATTu melkURu viTaiyapurap[pa]RRile koTTakarkkuTiyile patin_ oru-veli nila-
[6.] m iRaiyiliyAka iraNTAvatu vaikA[ci] mAtam mutal kuTuttom [3*] in_nilam patin_ oru-
[page 2-247]
[7.] veliyam583 cantiRAtittavaRcelluvatAkakkallilum cempilum veTTikkoLka [4*]
[8.] in_nilattuk[ku] kAtATamai584 maravaTai pun_payi[r*] kuLavaTai [a]LavuvaRkam uRainA[zi] veTTi-
[9.] meRppATikAval araikkAlvAci uLLiTTa an_aittu vaRkamum uTpaTTatum
[10.] ivvUr nattattil opAtiyum [u]Tppapa585 iRaiyiliyAkakkallilum cempilum ve-
[11.] TTikkoL[La]ccon_n_om586 [5*] ippaTikku ivai pazantiparAyar ezuttu 587in_n_alattu-
[12.] kku nAn_kellaiyum tiruccUlakkallu nATTikkoLka ivai koTumaLUr u-
[13.] TaiyAn_ ezuttu ivai kayalUr uTaiyA-
[14.] n_ ezuttu yANTu iraNTAvatu nAL 334 [6*]


TRANSLATION.



1. Hail ! Prosperity ! (The following are) the contents of an order, which was written concerning (the village of) Koṭṭagarkkuḍi, alias Ulagāṇḍanāyaki-nallūr.
2. Tribhuvanachakravartin Kōnēriṉmai-koṇḍāṉ (address the following order) to the authorities (tāṉattār) of the temple (kōyil) of the lord Śrī-Rājarājēśvara (at) Tañjāvūr:--
3. "From the month of Vaigāśi in the second (year of our reign), we have given as tax-free land eleven vēli) in (the village of) Koṭṭagarkkuḍi in Viḍaiyapura-paṟṟu, (which forms) the western portion (mēl-kūṟu) of Arumoṛdēva-vaḷanāḍu, for (providing) raw rice (amudu-paḍi)588 and other requirements to (the image of) Ulagu-muṛudum-uḍaiya-Nāchchiyār, which we have set up in this temple."
4. "Let it be engraved on stone and copper, that these eleven vēli of land shall remain (the property of that image) as long as the moon and the sun endure !"
5. "We have ordered it to be engraved on stone and copper, that this land shall be free from taxes, including the tax in money (kāśu-kaḍamai), (the taxes on) trees (maravaḍai), dry crops (puṉ-payir) and tanks (kuḷavaḍai),589 the tax on measures (aḷavu-varga),590 uṟai-nāṛ, (the share of) the village-watchman (who is placed) over the Veṭṭis, the eighth share (araikkāl-vāśi)591 and all other taxes (varga), and including the dues592 (obtaining) within the site (nattam) of this village."
6. This is the signature of Paṛandīparāyar. "Let stones (marked) with the sacred trident (tiru-śūla) be set up at the four boundaries of this land !" This is the signature of the headman (uḍaiyāṉ) of Koḍumaḷūr. This is the signature of the headman of Kayalūr. On the 334th day of the second year (of the king's reign).


No. 62. ON THE WEST WALL OF THE BRIHANNAYAKI SHRINE.



This modern inscription appears to record, that a certain Mallappa-Nāyakkar ordered the inhabitants of the village of Puliyūr to build the maṇḍapa which adjoins the Bṛhan-[page 2-248]nāyakī shrine, and which was called "the maṇḍapa of Mūrti-Ammaṉ," and that he rewarded their services by assigning to them the remnants of the offerings to the {??} for "as long as the moon and the sun endure." The name which is applied to the g{??} the Tanjore temple in this inscription, Periya-Uḍaiya-nāyaṉār, "the great {??}" evidently the Tamil prototype of the present designation Bṛhad-Īśvara.


TEXT.



[1.] tañcAvur periyauTaiyanAyan_Ar koyil mallappanAyakkar maNTapam
[2.] mURttiamman_ maNTapam puliyUrAr ta[n_]mmAka [ka]llu varukai[yi]-
[3.] n_Alum avarka[L] paNNiRa593 Uziyattin_Alum can_[n_a]tiyil oTukku[m] piRa-
[4.] [c]Atam kaTTaLaiyiTTapaTiyAle cantirA[ti]ttavar[ai]yum naTakkavum [||*]


TRANSLATION.



As the stones (for) the maṇḍapa) of Mūrti-Ammaṉ, --a maṇḍapa (which) Mallappa-Nāyakkar (had built in) the temple (of) Periya-Uḍaiya-nāyaṉār (at) Tañjāvūr,--were supplied gratis (by) the inhabitants of Puliyūr, and as these people did work (gratis), it was ordered that the remnants of the offerings (prasāda) before the shrine should be given (to them). Accordingly, let (these gifts) continue as long as the moon and the sun endure


PART III.[page 2-249]





SUPPLEMENT TO THE FIRST AND SECOND VOLUMES.





I.--ADDITIONAL INSCRIPTIONS IN THE TANJAVUR TEMPLE.



In the introductory remarks to No. 58 (page 229 f.) I had occasion to refer to four inscriptions of Rājarājadēva, the lower portions of which are buried underground. Two of these (Nos. 65 and 66),--which, to judge from their beginnings, promised a rich harvest of proper names,--were since temporarily excavated, and impressions of them taken, by my assistants. This led to the discovery of two further inscriptions, which are engraved under-neath No. 66, one of Rājēndradēva (No. 67), and one of Vikrama-Chōḷadēva (No. 68). I did not consider it worth while to excavate and copy the whole of Nos. 63 and 64, but shall now publish their first two lines as specimens.


No. 63. ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE NORTH ENCLOSURE.



From the published portion of No. 63, we learn that this inscription consists of a list of shepherds who had to supply ghee for temple lamps from the milk of a number of cattle, which had been presented to the temple before the 29th year of the reign of Rājarājadēva by the king himself and by others, or bought from the funds of the temple. To each lamp were allotted 96 ewes,594 or 48 cows, or 16 she-buffaloes. The daily supply for each lamp was one uṛakku of ghee.


TEXT.



[1.] [svasti SrI ||] tiruma[ka]L polapperunilaccelvi[yu]ntan_ak[k]eyurimai pUNTa-mai595man_akk[o]Lkk[A]n[taLU]rccAlai kalamaRuttaru[Li] vegkainATugkagkapA-TiyunuLampapATiyuntaTikaipATiyugkuTamalainATugkollamugkali[g]kamum eNTicai pukaz tara IzamaNTalamum iraTTapATi ezarai ilakkamun[ti]NTiRal ven_- [Ri]ttaNTARkoNTa tan_n_e[zi]l vaLarUziyuLellAyA[N]Tuntozutaka [vi]Lagkum yANTe ceziyaraitt[ecu] koL korA[ja]kEsarivarmmarAn_a [SrI]rAjarAjadEvarkku yANTu irupat[t]on_patAvatu varai [uT]aiyAr SrIrAjarAjIzvaram uTaiyArkkut[ti]ru[viLa]kku[k]ku uTaiy[Ar] SrIrAjarAja-dEvar kuTutta kAlmAT[Tilu]gkuTuttA[r ku]Tutta [k]A[lm]AT[Ti]lugkA-[cu ku]Tuttu mutalAn_a kAl[mA]T[Ti]lum [ti]ru[vi]Lakkukku ney a[La]kkak-kaTava[r]kaLAka iTai[ya]r va[zi ti]ru[vi]Lakku on_Rin_ukku ATu toN-NURRA[RA]kavum pacu [nA]RpatteTTAkavum erumai pa[ti]nARAka[vum ivai-yiR]Ru-
[2.] k[ku pa]cuvin_ ka[n_]Ru[m] erutum [pa]cuccArttikkuTutta[n_a pa]cuvAkavum AT-TukkuTTiyugkiTAyum ATu cArttikkuTuttan_a ATA[ka]vum erumaikkan_[Ru]gki-[page 2-250]TAvum erumai cArttikkuTuttan_a erumaiy[A]kavum mATaTuttu mATu ko-NTa iTaiyarum ivarka[L] uRavumuRaiyAy aTaikuTikaLAn_Arum ivarkaL aTaikuTikaLuntiruviLakku on_Rin_ukku ATavallAnAl nicatam ney uzakkA-kattAgkaLuntagkaL va[rggat]tArum candrAdityavat uTaiyAr paNTAratte ney aLa[k]kakkaTavarka[LAka] kallil v[e]TTin_apaTi ||--[1*] uTaiy[A]r SrIrAjarAjadEvar kuTutta kAlmATTil tiruviLakkukku aTuttapaTi [2*] tañcAvUr[p]pu[Ra]mpaTi [gAndha]rvvat[t]eruvil irukkum iT[ai]yan_ [cU]RRi pAkkaranukku aTutta [pacu nA]Rpatt[e]TTin_Al tiruviLakku on_Rin_ukku ivan_ [t]Anum ivan_ [a]TaikuTi ivan_ uTan_ piRanta [cURRi] nAra[Na]n_um cURRi [cIrA]Lanum ciRRappan_ ma[ka]n_ c[o]lai kurava[num] vaTa[ka]raikku-n_RakkURRamA[n_a] ut[tugka]tugkavaLanATTu pazu[vUr i]rukkum iT[ai]-
[3.]••••••••••••••••


TRANSLATION.



1. Hail ! Prosperity ! Until the twenty-ninth year (of the reign) of Kō-Rājakēsari-varman, alias Śrī-Rājarājadēva, who, in his life of growing strength, during which,-- (in) the belief that, as well as the goddess of fortune, the goddess of the great earth had become his wife,--he was pleased to destroy the ships (at) Kāndaḷūr-Śālai,596 and con-quered by his army, which was victorious in great battles, Vēṅgai-nāḍu, Gaṅga-pāḍi, Nuḷamba-pāḍi, Taḍigai-pāḍi, Kuḍamalai-nāḍu, Kollam, Kaliṅgam, Īṛa-maṇ-ḍalam, (the conquest of which) made (him) famous (in) the eight directions,597 and the seven and a half lakshas of Iraṭṭa-pāḍi,--deprived the Śeṛyas (i.e., the Pāṇḍyas) of (their) splendour at the very moment when (they were) resplendent (to such a degree) that (they were) worthy to be worshipped everywhere;598--cattle had been given by the lord Śrī-Rājarāja-dēva599 for (burning) sacred lamps before the lord of the Śrī-Rājarājēśvara (temple); (other) cattle had been given by (other) donors; and (other) cattle were represented by funds (mudal),600 as money (kāśu) had been paid (for their purchase into the temple treasury). (These) cattle were assigned to shepherds (Iḍaiyar), who had to supply ghee for the sacred lamps (from their milk), at the rate of ninety-six ewes, or forty-eight cows, or sixteen she-buffaloes for[page 2-251] each sacred lamp. Besides, calves and bulls which were given along with cows, (had to be reckoned) as cows; lambs and rams which were given along with ewes, as ewes; and buffalo calves and he-buffaloes which were given along with she-buffaloes, as she-buffaloes. The shepherds who had received the cattle, themselves and their people, (viz.) their rela-tions, and the relations of the latter, had to supply ghee to the treasury of the lord, as long as the moon and the sun endure, at the daily rate of (one) uṛakku of ghee by the Āḍavallāṉ (measure) for each sacred lamp. (The names of these shepherds) were engraved on stone as follows:--
2. The cattle which had been given by the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva, were assigned to sacred lamps as follows:--
3. From forty-eight cows, which were assigned to the shepherd Śūṟṟi Pākkaraṉ (i.e., Bhāskara), who resides in the [Gāndha]rva Street within the limits601 of Tañjāvūr,-- he himself and his relations, (viz.) his uterine brothers [Śūṟṟi] Nāra[ṇ]aṉ (i.e., Nārāyaṇa) and Śūṟṟi [Śīrā]ḷaṉ,602 and (his) uncle's son [Śō]lai Kuravaṉ,603 [the shepherd]•••••••••• who resides at Paṛu[vūr] in Vaḍakarai-Kuṉṟa-kūṟṟam, alias Ut[tuṅga]tuṅga-vaḷanāḍu,•••••••••• [have to supply] for one sacred lamp••••••••••


No. 64. ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE NORTH ENCLOSURE.



As appears from its 1st paragraph, this inscription is a continuation of No. 63. The published portion of the 2nd paragraph refers to a shepherd who had received 96 ewes,604 viz., 69 ewes given by Rājarājadēva, and 27 ewes purchased for 9 kāśu, in order to supply ghee for a temple lamp.


TEXT.



[1.] [svasti SrIH] [||*] uTaiyAr [SrI]rAjarAjad[E]var kuTutta kAlmATTilugkuTu-ttAr kuTutta kAlm[A]TTilugkAcum akkamugkuTuttu mutalAn_a kAlmATTilun-tiruviLakkukku aTuttapaTi kallil veTTin_a [1*] tañcAvU[rppu]Ram[pa]Ti gAndharvvateruvil irukkum iTaiya[n_] vi•••••••••• [u]- Tai[yAr SrIrAjarA]jadE[var ku]Tutta [k]AlmATTil aTutta
[2.] [A]Tu a[Ru]patton_[pa]tum peruntaram [ut]taragkuTaiyAn_ kera[LavI]tivi-Tagkan_An_a [vi]llava[mU]ventaveLAn_ tan_n_ai uTaiyAr SrIrAjarAjadEvar kozipporil [U]ttai aTTAmal en_Ru kaTava tiruviLakkukku vait[ta] kAcil kuTutta kAcu on_[pati]n_Al k[Acu on_Rin_ukku ATu] mU[n_RAka]•• ••••••••605 [toNNURRARin_Al ti]-
[3.]••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••


TRANSLATION.



1. Hail ! Prosperity ! There were engraved on stone (the names of the shepherds) to whom had been assigned, for (burning) sacred lamps, cattle given by the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva,[page 2-252] cattle given by (other) donors, and cattle which were represented by funds, as kāśu and akkam606 had been paid (for their purchase into the temple treasury):--
2. [To] the shepherd•••••••••• who resides in the Gāndharva Street within the limits of Tañjāvūr, were assigned sixty-nine ewes out of the cattle which had been given by the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva; and (to the same shepherd) were given nine kāśu out of the money which had been deposited by the Perundaram607 [Ut]taraṅg-uḍaiyāṉ Kēra[ḷa-Vī]diviḍaṅgaṉ,608 alias [Vi]llava-Mūvēnda-Vēḷāṉ, for (burning) a sacred lamp, which he had vowed (to put up) because the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva did not take his life609 in the battle of Kōṛ.610 [At the rate of three ewes for each kāśu,611 this comes to twenty-seven ewes. Altogether, (the shepherd received) ninety-six ewes. From (these)] •••••••••••••••••••••••••••••••


No. 65. ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE NORTH ENCLOSURE.



This inscription records an order of king Rājarājadēva, by which he assigned a daily allowance of paddy to each of forty-eight persons, whom he had appointed before the 29th year of his reign, in order to recite the Tiruppadiyam in the temple, and to two persons who had to accompany the others on drums. This statement is of considerable importance for the history of Tamil literature612 as an unmistakable proof of the existence of the Śaiva hymns which go by the name of padigam or padiyam, and which are collected in the Dēvāram, in the time of Rājarāja. The names of the fifty incumbents serve to corroborate this identi-fication of the Tiruppadiyam with the Dēvāram, as part of them are derived from the names of the three authors of the Dēvāram,613 viz., Tirunāṉaśambandaṉ (paragraph 7) or Śam-bandaṉ (10, 22, 34, 38, 42), Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ614 (6, 12, 14, 19, 28, 43, 45), and Nambi-Ārūraṉ (41, 44) or Ārūraṉ (19, 22). The name of two other incumbents, Śīrāḷaṉ (13, 15),615 is derived from Śīrāḷadēvar, one of the sixty-three Śaiva devotees, who is referred to in No. 43, paragraph 19. A number of other names pre-supposes the exist-ence of certain Śaiva temples which, without exception, are mentioned in the Periyapurā-ṇam. Among these are the temples at Tiruvāñjiyam (2), Ārūr (8) or Śrī-Ārūr (21),[page 2-253] Tiruvāymūr (30), Maṟaikkāḍu (41) or Tirumaṟaikkā[ḍu] (17), Aiyāṟu (46), and perhaps Tiruviḍaimarudūr (51). The name Veṇkāḍaṉ (16, 27, 29, 36, 40) is derived from Veṇkāḍu or Tiruveṇkāḍu, after which the mother of the saint Śīrāḷadēvar was called Tiruveṇkāṭṭu-Naṅgai.616 The god at Chidambaram is alluded to by the names Ambalavaṉ (11), Ambalattāḍi (4, 47), Ambalakkūttaṉ (18), Kūttaṉ (20, 26, 29, 31, 49), Tillaikkūttaṉ (49), Tillaikkaraiśu (33), and Eḍuttapādam (9, 24, 32).
The name Tiruveṇāval (3) is identical with tiru-veṇ-ṇāval, "the sacred white jambū tree" in the Śaiva temple on the island of Śrīraṅgam near Trichinopoly. This temple is now called Jambukēśvara, Tiruvāṉaikkāval617 or (by the Post Office) Tiruvāṉaikkōyil. The first of these three names means "(the image of) Īśvara (i.e., Śiva) (under) the jambū (tree)," and the two others are corruptions of the ancient name of the locality, viz., Tiru-vāṉaikkā, "the sacred elephant-grove." The full designation of the god, as used in the Jambukēśvara inscriptions, is "the lord of the sacred elephant-grove (Tiruvāṉaikkā), alias the lord of the three worlds, who is pleased to reside gladly under the shade of the sacred white jambū tree (tiru-veṇ-ṇāval)." This name and the modern name Jambukēśvara refer to an ancient legend, which is thus narrated in the Periyapurāṇam (p. 239 of the Madras edition of 1888):--"In a grove near the Chandratīrtha (i.e., the Moon-tank) in the Chōḷa country, a liṅga of Śiva made its appearance under a white jambū tree (veṇ-ṇāval). This was daily worshipped by a white elephant. Therefore the place received the name of "the sacred elephant-grove" (Tiruvāṉaikkā). Over the liṅga, a spider constructed a canopy, in order to prevent dry leaves from dropping on the liṅga. When the elephant saw the cobwebs, he tore them down, because he considered them out of place. The spider became angry, crawled into the trunk of the elephant and bit it. The animal dashed its trunk on the ground and died. So did the spider. In due course, the spider was reborn as the son of the Chōḷa king Śubhadēva and of his queen Kamalavatī. The boy received the name Kō-Śeṅgaṇ-ṇāṉ618 and inherited his father's kingdom. He possessed the faculty of remembering his former births and constructed a temple of Śiva near the white jambū tree in the sacred elephant-grove, where he, as a spider, had formerly worshipped the liṅga." A distinct allusion to this legend occurs in a Jambukēśvara inscription of the Pāṇḍya king Kō-Māṟa-varman, alias Kulaśēkharadēva, which mentions "the sacred street called after (the god) who transformed a spider into a Chōḷa (king)."619 That the legend, and the Jambukēśvara temple itself, was in existence in about A.D. 1000, may be concluded from the subjoined inscription, in which the word tiruve[ṇ]ṇāval forms part of the name of one of the donees.
Of historical interest is the name Rājādittaṉ (47), which appears to have been be-stowed on its bearer in commemoration of Rājāditya; the Chōḷa contemporary of the Rāshṭrakūṭa king Kṛshṇa III.620


TEXT.

[page 2-256]

TRANSLATION.



1. Hail ! Prosperity ! Until the twenty-ninth year (of the reign) of Kō-Rājakēsari-varman, alias Śrī-Rājarājadēva, who, in his life of growing strength, during which,-- (in) the belief that, as well as the goddess of fortune, the goddess of the great earth had become his wife,--he was pleased to destroy the ships (at) Kāndaḷūr-Śālai, and conquered by his army, which was victorious in great battles, Vēṅgai-nāḍu, Gaṅga-pāḍi, Taḍigai-pāḍi, Nuḷamba-pāḍi, Kuḍamalai-nāḍu, Kollam, Kaliṅgam, Īṛa-maṇḍalam, (which was the country) of the Śiṅgaḷas who possessed rough strength, the seven and a half lakshas of Iraṭṭa-pāḍi, and twelve thousand ancient islands of the sea,--deprived the Śeṛyas of (their) splendour at the very moment when (they were) resplendent (to such a degree) that (they were) worthy to be worshipped everywhere;--the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva had given, --for reciting the Tiruppadiyam before the lord of the Śrī-Rājarājēśvara (temple),-- forty-eight musicians (Piḍārar), one person who should constantly beat the small drum626 in their company, and one person who should constantly beat the big drum (koṭṭi-mattaḷam)627 in their company. These fifty persons were to receive from the city treasury of the lord a daily allowance (nibandha) of three kuṟuṇi of paddy each, (measured) by the marakkāl called (after) Āḍavallāṉ, which is equal to a rājakēsari. Instead of those among these persons, who would die or emigrate,628 the nearest relations of such persons were to receive that paddy and to recite the Tiruppadiyam. If the nearest relations of such persons were not qualified themselves, they were to select (other) qualified persons, to let (these) recite the Tiruppadiyam, and to receive that paddy. If there were no near relations to such persons, the (other) incum-bents of such appointments629 were to select qualified persons for reciting the Tiruppadiyam, and the person selected was to receive the paddy in the same way, as that person (whom he represented), had received it. Accordingly, (the names of these fifty persons) were engraved on stone, as the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva had been pleased to order:--
2. To Pālaṉ (i.e., Bāla) Tiruvāñji[ya]ttaḍigaḷ,630 alias Rājarāja-Pichchaṉ, alias Sadāśivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
3. To Tiruveṇāval Śemboṟ[chōdi], alias Dakshiṇa-Mēru-Viṭaṅka-Pichchaṉ, alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
4. To Paṭṭālagaṉ631 [Am]balattāḍi,632 alias Manōtma-Śivaṉ,633 three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
5. To Paṭṭālagaṉ Śīru[ḍ]aikkaṛal,634 alias Pūrva-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
6. To Poṟchuvaraṉ Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias Pūrva-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
[page 2-257]
7. To Mādēvaṉ (i.e., Mahādēva) Tirunāṉaśambandaṉ, alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
8. To Kayilāyaṉ (i.e., Kailāsa) Ārūr, alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
9. To [Śeṭ]ṭi Eḍuttap[ādam],635 alias Kavacha-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
10. To Irāmaṉ (i.e., Rāma) Śambandaṉ, alias Satya-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
11. To Amba[la]vaṉ-[Pa]t[ta]rga[ḷ]636••••• alias Vāma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
12. To Kam[b]aṉ Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias Sadāśivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
13. To Nakkaṉ (i.e., Nagna) Śīrāḷaṉ, alias Vāma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
14. To [A]ppi Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias Nētra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
15. To Śivakko[ṛu]ndu637 Śīrāḷan, alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
16. To Aiññūṟṟuvaṉ Veṇkāḍaṉ, alias Satya-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
17. To Araiyaṉ A[ṇu]kkaṉ, alias Tirumaṟaikkā••••• [alias Dharma-Śi]vaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
18. To Araiyaṉ Am[bala]kkūttaṉ,638 alias Ōṁ[kā]ra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
19. To Ārūraṉ Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
20. To Kūttaṉ639 Maṛalaichchilam[b]u, alias Pūrva-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
21. To Aiññūṟṟuvaṉ Śīy[ā]rūr,640 alias Ta[tpuru]sha-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
22. To [Śamba]ndaṉ Ārūraṉ, alias Vāma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
23. To Araiyaṉ Pich[chaṉ], alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
24. To Kā[śyap]aṉ Eḍutta[pā]da-Pichchaṉ, alias Rudra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
25. To Subrahmaṇyaṉ [Ā]chchaṉ, alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
26. To Kūttaṉ Amarabhujaṁgaṉ, alias Satya-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
27. To ••••• Veṇkāḍaṉ, alias Aghōra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
[page 2-258]
28. To Mādēvaṉ Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias Vijñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
29. To Kūttaṉ Veṇkāḍaṉ, alias Rudra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
30. To Aiññūṟṟuvaṉ Tiru[vā]y[mū]r,641 alias Aghōra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
31. To Tirumalai Kūttaṉ, alias Vāma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
32. To Aiññūṟṟuvaṉ Eḍuttapādam, alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
33. To Araiyaṉ Tillaikkaraiśu,642 alias Pūrva-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
34. To Kā[ḷi] Śambandaṉ, alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
35. To Kā[p]ālika-Vāli, alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
36. To Veṇkāḍaṉ Namaśśivā[yam], alias Rudra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
37. To Śivaṉ Aṉantaṉ, alias Yōga-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
38. To Śivakkoṛu[ndu] Śambandaṉ, alias Aghōra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
39. To [Irāmaṉ Kaṇava]di (i.e., Gaṇapati), alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
40. To [Pi]chchaṉ Veṇkāḍaṉ, alias Aghōra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
41. To Maṟaikkāḍaṉ643 Nambi-Ārūraṉ, alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
42. To Śō[m]aṉ (i.e., Sōma) Śambandaṉ, alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
43. To Śatti (i.e., Śakti) Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias [Ī]śāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
44. To Poṟchuvaraṉ Nambi-Ā[rūraṉ], alias Dharma-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
45. To Āchchaṉ Tirunāvukkaraiyaṉ, alias Nētra-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
46. To Aiyāṟaṉ644 Peṇṇōrbāgaṉ,645 alias Hṛda[ya-Śi]vaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
47. To Rājādi[tt]aṉ Ambalattāḍi, alias Śikhā-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
48. To [Ś]elvaṉ Ka[ṇa]vadi Te[m]baṉ, alias [Dharma-Śi]vaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
49. To Kūttaṉ Tillaikkūttaṉ,646 alias Ñāna-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
[page 2-259]
50. For beating the small drum, to Sūryadēva-Kramavittaṉ,647 alias••••• Viḍaṅga-Uḍukkai-Vijjādiraṉ,648 alias Sōma-Śivaṉ, the son of [Ta]ttaya-Kramavittaṉ of [Dv]ēdaigōmapuṟam,649 three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.
51. For beating the big drum, to Guṇappu[ga]ṛ Marudaṉ,650 alias Śikhā-Śivaṉ, three kuṟuṇi of paddy per day.


No. 66. ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE NORTH ENCLOSURE.



This very long inscription, which bears the same date as No. 65, and resembles it in style, records an order of king Rājarājadēva, by which he assigned the produce of certain land to a number of men who had to perform various services in connection with the temple, and to four hundred women, evidently dancing-girls, who had been transferred to the establishment of the Rājarājēśvara temple from that of other temples in the Chōḷa country. Each person received one or more shares, each of which consisted of the produce of one vēli of land, which was calculated at 100 kalam of paddy. This statement is valuable, as it enables us to ascertain, by a comparison of the produce in paddy with the extent of the land, that the unnamed land-measure, which is referred to in two other Tañjāvūr inscriptions of Rājarāja (Nos. 4 and 5), is meant for the vēli. According to the Dictionnaire Tamoul-Français, the modern equivalent of the vēli is 26, 755 square metres.
Paragraphs 3 to 402 contain a list of the names of the dancing-girls whom Rājarāja had imported and settled in the neighbourhood of the Tañjāvūr temple. The names of some of these women are of historical interest, as they refer to the designations of sacred places and of royal personages. Of the latter kind are:--Rājarāji (paragraphs 65 and 268), Rājakēsari (10), and Arumoṛ651 (236, 369), which are derived from different names of the reigning king. The name Kundavai (215) is identical with that of Rājarāja's elder sister,652 and the name Aṟiñji (400) appears to be connected with Ariṁjaya, the Sanskrit name of his grandfather.653 The name Śeyya-Śōṛam (280) may be connected with the Chōḷa king Śeṅgaṇ,654 and the name Kaṉṉaradēvi (244) reminds of king Kaṉṉaradēva, whom Mr. Venkayya has satisfactorily identified with the Rāshṭrakūṭa king Kṛshṇa III.655 To the name of each woman is prefixed the name of the temple or village, to which she had been attached before her final transfer to the Rājarājēśvara temple. On the basis of these references, and of the names of part of the women themselves, which allude to temples and villages, we can draw up a list of temples which were already in existence[page 2-260] when Rājarāja founded the Tañjāvūr temple. Among the Śaiva temples, the more ancient ones will be those whose names are also mentioned in the Periyapurāṇam. I subjoin a list of these Śaiva shrines, adding in brackets their names in the Periyapurāṇam, whenever they differ in form from the names recorded in the inscription:--
Tiruvaraneṟi or Araneṟi (Araṉeṟi) at Tiruvārūr; Tirumaṇḍaḷi (Paravaiyuṇ-Maṇḍaḷi) at Tiruvārūr; Tirumūlaṭṭāṉam (Mūlaṭṭāṉam at Tiruvārūr); Tirumāgā-ḷam (Māgāḷam) at Ambar; Tirukkārōṇam or Kārōṇam at Nāgapaṭṭaṉam (Nāgai); Tiruvāchchirāmam (Āchchirāmam) at Pāchchil; Tiruppādāḷi-Īśvara (Pādāḷīch-charam) at Pāmbuṇi; Vaḍataḷi at Paṛaiyāṟu (Paṛaiyāṟai); Ambalam, Poṉṉam-balam, Tillai, Poṟkōyil-Tillai, or Maṉṟam (Śidambaram); Āmāttūr; Kaḍambūr; Kaṇḍiyūr; Kāṟāyil (Kāṟāyal); Karuvūr; Kōṭṭūr; Nallūr; Naṉṉilam; Niya-mam (Parudi-Niyamam); Oṟṟiyūr (Tiruvoṟṟiyūr); Pandaṇanallūr; Paṛuvūr (Tiruppaṛuvūr); Talaiyālaṅgāḍu; Tiruchchōṟṟuttuṟai (Śōṟṟuttuṟai); Tiruk-koḷḷambūdūr (Koḷḷambūdūr); Tirumaṟaikkāḍu or Maṟaikkāḍu (Vēdāraṇiyam); Tirunettāṉam (Neyttāṉam); Tiruppaṛaṉam; Tiruppūvaṇam or Pūvaṇam; Tirut-teṅgūr (Teṅgūr); Tiruvaiyāṟu or Aiyāṟu; Tiruvālaṅgāḍu; Tiruvāṉaikkā;656 Tiruvēdiguḍi (Vēdiguḍi); Tiruviḍaimarudil (Tiruviḍaimarudūr); Tūṅgāṉai (Tūṅgāṉai-Māḍam); Vaḍavāyil (Vaḍamullaivāyil); Vayalūr (Viyalūr); and Veṇ-kāḍu (Tiruveṇkāḍu).
A few of the women are called after Vaishṇava shrines which are mentioned in the Nālāyiraprabandham, viz., Araṅgam (Śrīraṅgam), Tiruvēṅgaḍam (Tirumalai), Āli (Tiruvāli), and Śīkurugūr (Tirukkurugūr). Others were transferred to Tañjāvūr from temples which, to judge from the second part of their names,657 belong to the Vaishṇava sect, viz., Avaṉinārāyaṇa-Viṇṇagar at Ambar, Śrītāṛ-Viṇṇagar at Arapuram, and Śrīpūdi-Viṇṇagar at Pāmbuṇi.
The second part of the inscription (paragraphs 403 to 510) consists of a list of male temple servants, viz., dancing-masters, musicians, drummers, singers, accountants, parasol-bearers, lamp-lighters, watermen, potters, washermen, barbers, astrologers, tailors, a brazier, carpenters, a goldsmith, and others the reading or meaning of whose designations remains doubtful. Some of these persons are called after king Rājarāja (paragraphs 424, 425, 447, 466, 493, 494, 496, 498, 503) and after his surnames Arumoṛ (406, 466), Mummaḍi-Chōḷa658 (403, 404, 423, 436, 455, 465, 486), Nityavinōda659 (413, 504), Rājakēsarin (467), and Rājāśraya660 (413); others after his father Parāntaka (448, 458, 496) and after his grandfather Arimjaya (416, 507, 509). The two names Kaṇḍarāditta (505) and Madurāntaka (504) probably refer to the two Chōḷa kings Gaṇḍarāditya and Madhurāntaka.661 The name Taila (435) reminds of the Western Chālukya king Taila II. Other names are derived from the following Śaiva shrines which are mentioned in the[page 2-261] Periyapurāṇam:--Aiyāṟu (Tiruvaiyāṟu), Ambalam (Śidambaram), Ārūr (Tiruvārūr), Karugāvūr, Maṇañjēri or Tirumaṇañjēri, Maṟaikkāḍu (Vēdāraṇiyam), Maṛapāḍi (Tirumaṛapāḍi), Nettāṉam (Neyttāṉam), Oṟṟiyūr (Tiruvoṟṟiyūr), and Vaḍavāyil (Vaḍamullaivāyil). Finally, three men are called after the Vaishṇava shrines at Araṅgam (Śrīraṅgam), Tiruveḷḷaṟai, and Tiruvēṅgaḍam (Tirumalai), which are mentioned in the Nālāyiraprabandham.


TEXT.





First section.

[22.] m [vI]Tu [arapu]rattu SrI[tA]zivi[NNa]ka[r na]kkan_ [puka]zik[kup]pagku on_- Rum ||--[32*] muppatton_[RA]m [vI]Tu ivvUrttik[ai]ppi[r]AT[Ti]- I[zvarattu nakka]n_ [pA]ñcATikkuppagku [on_]Rum ||--[33*] [mup]- patti[raN]TA[m*] vITu i[tta]-
[23.] [Li] nakkan_ karaNaviccAtirikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[34*] muppattumUn_[RA]m vITu tañcAvUr eriyUrnATTuttaLi nakkan_ cagkikkuppagku on_Rum [35*]
[24.] muppa[t]tu[n]AlAm [vI]Tu ittaLi nakkan_ ta[ra]Nikkuppagku [o]n_Rum ||-- [36*] muppattaiñ[cA]m vITu ittaLi nakkan_ [c]eTTikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[37*] mu[p]pa-
[25.] ttA[RA]m vITu ittaLi nakkan_ [a]ravattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[38*] mu[p]pattezAm vITu ittaLi nakkan_ nakkattu[k]kuppagku on_[Ru]m ||-- [39*] mu[ppa]tte-
[26.] TTAm vITu tiru[vArU]rpperiya[taLi]cceri nakkan_ cIruT[ai]yALukkup[pagku] on_[Ru]m ||--[40*] muppatton_patAm vITu [i]vvUr [brahmIzvara]ttu nakkan_ pa[ra]-[page 2-263]
[27.] v[ai]kku[ppa]gku [o]n_Rum ||--[41*] [n]ARpatAm vITu iv[vU]rpp[e]riyata-Licce[ri na]kka[n_ ma]za[lai]ccilampukku[ppag]ku [on_Ru]m ||--[42*] nAR-patton_RA[m] vITu i-
[28.] [vvUr]tti[ru]va[ra]neRi nakkan_ Ar[A a]mutukku[p]pagku on_Rum ||--[43*] nARpattira[N]T[A]m vI[Tu] ivvUr [aru]moziIzva[ra]ttu na[kkan_] cI[ka-N]Tikku[ppa]gku o[n_Rum] [44*]


Second section.



[1.] nARpat[tu]mUn_RAm vITu ivvUr ulakI[zva]ra[ttu nakkan_ pa]rAnte[ru]mAn_uk-kuppagku on_Rum ||--[45*] nA[R]pattunAlAm vITu [i]v[vU]rttiruvara-ne[Ri nak]kan_ [nArAyaNi]kkuppagku o[n_]Ru[m] [46*] [nARpattaiñcA]m vITu ittaLi nakkan_ aravattukkup[pag]ku on_Rum ||--[47*] nARpattA-RAm vI[Tu] tiruvA[rU]r brahmIzvarattu nakka[n_] coti[viLa]kkukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[48*] n[AR]pa[tt]ezAm [vI]Tu [iv]vUr ulakIzvarattu nak-kan_ tik[ai]ccuTarukku[p]pagku on_Ru[m] [49*] [nAR]pat[teTTAm vITu iv]vUr brahmIzvarattu [na]kkan_ A[li]kkuppa[gku on_Ru]m ||--[50*] nARpatton_patAm vITu maT[T]ai [te]n_[ta]Li nakkan_ cIkaNTikku[p]pagku on_Rum [||--] [51*] [aim]patAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ peRRatiruvukkuppa-g[ku] on_Rum ||--[52*] aimpatton_RAm [vI]Tu tañcAvUrttañcaimA-ma[Ni]kkoyil nakka-
[2.] n_ [vIraco]zikku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[53*] aimpa[ttiraNT]Am vITu [cIkaNTapura]t[tu na]k[ka]n_ tiruv[A]la[gkA]Tikku[ppa]gku on_[Rum ||--] [54*] aim[pat]tu[mU]n_[RAm vI]Tu par[An]takapurattu [nak]kan_ p[e]••• [kkuppagku] on_Rum ||--[55*] aimpattunAlAm [vI]Tu ivvU[r] nakkan_ utta[ma]tAn_ikkuppagku on_Rum [||--] [56*] aimpattai[ñ]cAm vI[Tu ni]ya[ma]ttu arikulakecariIzvara[ttu] nakka[n_]•• [t]tu[k]kuppagku on_- Rum [||--] [57*] ai[m]pat[tA]RAm vITu ittaLi [na]kka[n_] ve[N]kA-[TTu]kku[ppagku on_Rum] [58*] [aimpattezAm vI]Tu i[t]taLi nakkan_ [kUttA]Tikkuppa[g]ku o[n_Rum] [59*] [ai]mpatteTTAm [vI]Tu ittaLi nakkan_ cozacULAma[Ni]kkup[pa]gku on_Ru[m] ||--[60*] ai[mpa]t[to]- n_pa[t]A[m vITu i]v[vU]r AyirattaLi nakkan_ [pU]g[k]A[vik]kuppagku on_- Rum ||--[61*] aRupatAm [vI]Tu ivvUr arikulakecariI[zvara]ttu nakkan_ [n]Añ[cUri]kku[p]pagku on_Rum [62*]
[3.] a[Rupat]ton_RAm vITu [niyama]ttu A[yira]t[taLi nak]ka[n_ te]vikkuppagku o[n_Ru]m ||--[63*] [aRupa]ttiraN[T]Am vITu amparttirumAkALattu nak[ka]n_ nagkU[ri]kku[p]pagku o[n_Rum] ||--[64*] [aRu]pattumUn_RAm [vI]Tu itta[Li] nakkan_ rAjarAjikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[65*] aRupat-tu[n]AlAm vITu itta[Li na]kka[n_ a]timA[n_i]kku[ppag]ku [o]n_[Rum ||--] [66*] [aRupat]taiñcAm [vI]Tu ivvUr ava[n_i]nArAya[NaviN]Nakar663 nakkan_ u[taiyattukkuppa]gku [on_Rum] ||--[67*] aRupattARAm [vI]Tu iv[vU]rtti[rumAkALattu na]kkan_ k[A]makk[o]Tikku[ppa]gku on_Rum [||--] [68*] [a]RupattezA[m vI]Tu iv[vU]r mu[tupa]kava[rtaLi] nakkan_ nicca-lukkuppagku o[n_]Rum ||--[69*] aRupatteTTAm [vI]Tu kaTampUrt-[ti]ruviLagkoyil nakkan_ ku[p]paikku[p]pag[ku on_Ru]m [70*]
[page 2-264]
[4.] aRupatt[on_]patAm [vI]Tu i[ttaLi nakkan_]•• vi••• [kku]664p[pa]g-[ku] o[n_]Rum ||--[71*] ezupatAm [vITu] ittaLicciRiya[na]kkan_ [na]k-kattukkuppag[ku] on_Rum ||--[72*] [e]zu[pa]tton_[RA]m [vITu] itta-Lipperiya[na]kkan_ [na]kkat[tuk]kuppagku on_Rum ||--[73*] ezupat[ti]ra-[N]TAm vITu iv[vU]r i[T]TAcciIzvarattu na[k]kan_ ta[raNi]va[r]A-hikku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[74*] ezupattumUn_RAm vITu tirumaRaikkA-[TTu nak]ka[n_] mAtevikku[ppa]gku on_[Rum] ||--[75*] ezupattu[n]A-lAm [vI]Tu viTai[ya]pu[rat]tu nakkan_ am[m]ARik[kuppag]ku on_[Ru]m [||--] [76*] ezupattaiñcAm vITu veLUr na[kkan_]••• tAppakaikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[77*] ezupattARAm vITu nayatIrapurattu nakkan_ tirunIlakaN-Tikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[78*]
[5.] ezu[pa]tte[z]Am vITu vIrapurattu [nakkan_ m]A[n_Apa]raNikkup[pa]gku on_- Rum ||--[79*] ezupat[teT]TAm [vI]Tu pAccil tirumeRRa[Li] nakkan_ peRRatiru[vu]kkuppag[ku] on_[Ru]m ||--[80*] ezupa[tton_]patAm vITu iv[vUr]ttiru[vA]ccirAmattu [na]kkan_ cozat[tukku]p[pa]gku [on_Ru]m ||--[81*] e[N]pa[t]Am vITu [i]vvUrttirume[RRa]Li [na]kkan_ cegku-Lat[tu]kkuppagku on_Ru[m] ||--[82*] e[N]patton_RAm vITu vIra[pu]- rattu [nakkan_]•• [kku]ppagku on_Rum ||--[83*] eNpattiraNTAm vITu ti[ru]kkoLLam[pUtUr nakka]n_ poRkecikku[p]pa[g]ku on_Rum ||-- [84*] eN[pat]tumUn_RAm vITu [i]vvUr nakkan_ ARA[yi]ra[ttukkup]pagku on_Ru[m] ||--[85*] eNpattunAlAm vITu kaRpakatAn_ipurattu nakkan_ tillaikkUttikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[86*] eNpatt[aiñcA]-

[16.] ppagku on_Rum ||--[168*] ezupattaiñc[Am vI]Tu•• n[taLi]p[puka]z- [matiI]zva[rattu] nakkan_ kulamA[n_u]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[169*] ezu-pattARAm vITu ittaLi nak[ka]n_ ka[ru]m[ANik]kattukkup[pag]ku on_Rum ||--[170*] ezupattue[zAm vITu pu]RaiyAcceri [na]kka[n_] na[ka]ra[t]tA-Lukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[171*] [ezupa]tt[e]T[TAm vI]Tu ni[ya]ma[t]tu Ayiratta[Li na]kkan_ ca[n]tirattuk[kuppa]g[ku o]n_Rum ||--[172*] [ezu-pa]tto[n_]patA[m vITu] i[v]vUr ari[ku]lakEsariIzvarattu nakkan_ [va]Ta-vAyilukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[173*] eNpatAm vITu ivvUr nRpak[E]- sariIzvarattu nakkan_ parA[n]terumAn_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[174*] eNpatton_RAm [vI]Tu i[v]vUrcca[n]tiramallI(I)zvarattu [na]kkan_ tiru-v[e]gkaTattukku-
[17.] ppagku on_[Ru]m ||--[175*] [eNpa]ttiraNTAm vITu [ivvU]r [a]riku-lak[Esari]Izvarattu [na]kkan_ caRpatevikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[176*] eN[pa]ttumUn_RAm [vI]Tu [na]n_n_ilattu tirumeRRa[Li] nakkan_ AmA[t]- tUrkkup[pa]gku o[n_Rum] [177*] e[N]pattunAlAm vITu [kAvi]rippUm-paTTan_attu nakkan_ UtAri[k]ku[ppa]gku [on_Ru]m ||--[178*] [eN]pa-[tt]ai[ñ]c[Am] vI[Tu] pa[zaiy]A[RRu araiyerum]An_[taLi nak]kan_ [cIla-cULAmaNikkup]pagku o[n_]Ru[m] ||--[179*] [e]N[pa]ttARAm vITu i[v]vUr avan_inArA[ya]Napurattu nakkan_ vikki[ra]mAtittikkuppa[g]ku o[n_]- Rum ||--[180*] eNpattezAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ tillainiRaintALu-kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[181*] eNpatteTTAm vITu ivvUr vaTataLi nakkan_ [naya]n_aval[li]-
[18.] [k]kup[pagku] o[n_Ru]m ||--[182*] e[Npa]tt[on_pat]A[m vI]Tu [it-taLi nakkan_ pe]RRatiruvukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[183*] toN[NU]RAm vITu Ayirat[taLi] mal[lIzvarattu na]kka[n_] matan_ava[l]li[kkup]pagku on_Rum ||--[184*] [t]o[NNURR]on_RAm [vI]Tu karuppUr nakka[n_] eTu[t]ta-pAtattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[185*] t[oNNUR]Rira[N]TA[m vITu] vI[rapurat]tu na[kkan_ mIn_avan_]mAt[evikkup]pa[gku o]n_Rum ||--[186*] [vaTakkil taLicce]ritte[n_ciRa]ku ta[laivI]Tu tiruvA[rU]r [brahmI]zvarattu nak-kan_ mUvarkaNTikkuppagku [on_Rum] ||--[187*] ira[N]TA[m vI]Tu nAka[pa]TTan_attuttirukkAroNattu [na]kkan_ cIruTaiyALukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[188*] mUn_RAm [vI]Tu arapurattu ni[ka]Lag[ki]Izvarattu nakkan_ tiru[vu]kkuppa[g*]-
[19.] ku o[n_Ru]m ||--[189*] nAlAm vITu [koT]Turkku[Na]vati[Izvarattu nakkan_ pe]RRatiruvukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[190*] aiñcAm vITu pA[m-puNi] SrI[pU]ti[viN]Na[kar nakkan_ pA]lu[k]ku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[191*] [A]RA[m vI]Tu [ka]R[pa]katAn_i[pura]ttu nakka[n_ kaR]pakatAn_ikkuppagku on_- Ru[m] ||--[192*] ezAm vITu tiruvA[rU]rpperiyata[Li]cceri nakka[n_] pa[n]ta[lukkuppa]g[ku] o[n_Rum] ||--[193*] [e]TTAm vI[Tu i]v[vU]r [nakkan_]•• [k]kup[pa]g[ku] on_Ru[m] ||--[194*] [on_pa]tAm vITu ta[Li]ccAttagkuTi nakkan_ am[palat]tukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[195*] [pa]ttAm vI[Tu tiruv]A[rUrpperiyataLi]cceri nakkan_ viraiyAccilaikkup-pagku on_Rum ||--[196*] patin_on_RAm vITu AyirattaLi nakkan_ an_a-[va]ratacuntarikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[197*] pan_n_i[raNTA]m[page 2-268]
[20.] vITu i[vvU]r [nak]kan_ rAja[cULA]maNikkuppagku o[n_Rum ||--] [198*] [patin_mUn_]RAm vITu nayatIra[pu]rattu nakkan_ aran[e]Rikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [199*] pati[n]AlA[m vITu A]yi[rattaLi nakka]n_ [paT]Tattukkup[pag]ku o[n_]Rum ||--[200*] pati[n_ai]ñcAm [vI]Tu iv[vUr] na[k]kan_ i[La]g-kAvuk[ku]ppag[ku o]n_Rum ||--[201*] [pa]ti[nA]RAm vITu tiruvA[rU]r [a]rum[o]zi[Izva]rattu nakkan_ m[o][Ti]kkuppagku [on_Rum] ||--[202*] pa[tinezAm vI]Tu iv[vUr] nakkan_ [karu]vUrkkup[pa]gku on_Rum ||-- [203*] [pa]ti[neT]TAm vITu parAn[taka]Izvara[ttu nak]kan_ [ti]ru[vA]n_ai-kkAvikkuppagku on_Ru[m] ||--[204*] patt[on_pat]Am vITu tiru[v]ai-yARRu nakkan_ ara[va]ttukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[205*] irupatAm vITu koTTUrp[pa]ñca[va]n_mAteviIzvarattu nakka[n_] cuntarikkuppagku on_Ru[m] ||--[206*]
[21.] [i]ru[patto]n_RAm vITu ittaLi nakkan_ nampANTikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [207*] irupattiraNTAm vITu ittaLi nakkan_ umaikkuppa[g]ku on_Rum ||--[208*] irupattumUn_RAm [vI]Tu itta[Li] nakka[n_ tiTT]aicce-[ri]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[209*] irupattun[A]lAm [vI]Tu itta[Li] nakkan_ umaikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[210*] irupattaiñcAm [vI]Tu [ti]ruvArUrt[ti]ruvarane[Ri]I[zvara]ttu nak[kan_ ci]t[ti]ravallik[kuppa]gku [o]n_Rum ||--[211*] [i]ru[pa]ttA[RAm vITu A]yirat[taLi] nakkan_ [pi]c[ci]kkuppagku o[n_Ru]m ||--[212*] irupatte[z]Am [vI]Tu [vi]- Taiyapura[ttu]p[pu]ka[zI]zvarattu nakkan_ peRRa[ti]ru[vuk]kuppagku on_Rum ||-- [213*] [irupa]tte[T]TAm [vI]Tu [ti]ruvA[rU]rt[ti]rumaNTa[Li na]kka[n_ cI]kaN[Ti]kkuppagku on_[Ru]m ||--[214*] irupatton_pa-
[22.] [tAm vITu] i[ttaLi] nak[ka]n_ kunta[v]aikkuppa[g]ku on_Rum ||--[215*] muppatAm vITu AyirattaLi mallIzvarattu nakkan_ pAkkarikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[216*] [mu]ppatton_RAm vITu [tiru]vA[rU]r brahmIzvarattu nakkan_ pon_[n_u]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[217*] muppattiraNTAm vITu [ja]na-nAthapurattu [vi]kra[ma]vijayaIzvara[ttu] nakkan_ [p]oRkumaran_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[218*] muppattu[mU]n_RA[m vI]Tu [pa]r[An]takaIzvara[ttu] nakkan_ comakon_u[kku]ppagku o[n_]Ru[m] ||--[219*] mup[pa]ttu[n]AlAm [vI]Tu ti[ru]v[ArU]r [aru]mozi[I]zva[ra]ttu na[kka]n_ e[ka]vI[rikkup]pagku [o]n_Rum ||--[220*] [mu]ppa[t]taiñcAm vI[Tu A]yiratta[Li] nakkan_ t[e]vik[kuppa]gku on_Rum ||--[221*] muppattARAm vITu iv[vUr] nakkan_ ti[ru]vaTikaLukku[p]pagku on_Rum [||--] [222*]
[23.] muppattezA[m] vITu [i]v[vU]rkka[riyana]kkan_ tiruvaTikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [223*] muppatteTTAm vITu tiruvetikuTi nakkan_ kaNTarAccikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[224*] muppatt[o][n_]patAm vITu ivvUr [na]k[ka]n_ kula-mA[Ni]kkattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[225*] nARpatAm vITu ARRuttaLi nakkan_•••• [kkuppagku o]n_Rum ||--[226*] nARpatton_RAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ vempikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[227*] nARpattiraNTAm vI[Tu ni]Rai[ma]tiIzvarattu nakkan_ poRkecikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [228*] [n]ARpattumUn_RAm vITu tiruccoRRuttuRai nakkan_ oRRiyUrk-kuppagku on_Rum ||--[229*] nARpattunAlAm vITu tirumaRaikkATTu
[24.] [na]kkan_ ni•••• [kkuppagku on_]Rum ||--[230*] nARpattaiñcAm vITu nan_n_ilattu tirumeRRaLi [na]kkan_ cagkANikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [231*] nARpattARAm vITu ivvUrttiruamalIzvarattu nakkan_ eRikkuppagku[page 2-269] on_Rum ||--[232*] nARpattezAm vITu uttamatAn_ipurattu nakkan_ pUvaNattukkuppa[gku on_Rum] [233*] [nARpa]tteTTAm vITu niyamattu AyirattaLi nakkan_ aTikaLukkuppag[ku o]n_Ru[m] [234*] [n]ARpatt[o]- n_patAm vITu [pazaiy]ARRu araiy[e]rumAn_taLi nakkan_ niRaNipavazakkun_Ru-kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[235*] aimpatAm [vI]Tu ittaLi nakkan_ a[ru]- mozikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[236*] aimpatton_RAm vITu ivvUrt-ten_taLi nakkan_ Accat-
[25.] tukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[237*] aimpattiraN[T]Am vITu ittaLicciRiya-nakkan_ Accattu[k]kuppagku on_Rum ||--[238*] aimpattumU[n_]RAm vITu ivvUr [va]TataLi nakkan_ amutattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[239*] aimpattunAlAm vITu ittaLi [na]kkan_ cULAmaNikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [240*] aimpattaiñcAm vITu ittaLi nakka[n_ e]kavIrikkuppagku on_- Rum ||--[241*] aimpattARAm vI[Tu i]vvUr muLLUrnakkan_taLi nak-[ka]n_ vIrANikkuppagku o[n_]Rum ||--[242*] aimpattezAm vITu it-taLi [nak]kan_ oru[p]pa[n_ai]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[243*] aimpatteT-TAm vITu koRRamagkalattu [na]kkan_ kan_n_a[rate]vikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [244*] aimpatton_[pa]tAm vITu tiruttegkUr nakkan_ kan_avatikkuppa[g]ku o[n_]Rum ||--[245*] a[Ru]patA-
[26.] m vITu cellUr nakkan_ eTTikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[246*] aRupat-ton_RAm vITu tiruvaiy[A]RRu nakkan_ ampalakkUttikkuppagku o[n_]Rum ||--[247*] aRupattiraNTAm vITu nA[ka]paTTan_attuccen_Amukattu nakkan_ an_antattukku[p]pagku on_Rum ||--[248*] aRupattumUn_RAm vITu tañ- cAvUr[tta]ñcaimAmaNikk[oyi]l nakkan_ [vazuvA]ni[lai]kku[ppa]gku o[n_]- Ru[m] ||--[249*] aRupat[tu]nAlAm vITu [o]lokamahAdEviIzvarattu [na]kkan_ [cI]tevi[kku]ppagku o[n_]Rum ||--[250*] [a]RupattaiñcAm vITu [pa]rAnta[kapura]ttu nak[ka]n_ ezuvaNaikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[251*] aRupattARAm vITu [ti]ruvaiyARRu nakkan_ pon_n_ukkup[pa]gku on_Rum ||--[252*] aRu[pa]ttezAm vITu [pa]zuvUr[p]pakai[vi]TaiIzva-
[27.] rattu nakkan_ pazuvUrkkuppagku on_Rum ||--[253*] aRupatteTTAm vITu kaTampUr iTTAcciIzvarattu nakkan_ civatevikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [254*] aRupatton_patAm [vI]Tu tiruvArUrpperi[ya]taLicceri nakkan_ cIkurukUrukkup[pa]gku on_Rum ||--[255*] ezu[pa]tAm vITu nan_n_ilat-tuttirumeRRaLi nakkan_ [ca]gkA[Ni]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[256*] ezupatton_RAm vITu [ti]ru[viTai]marutil nakkan_ cempi[ya]n_mAte[vi]kkup-pagku on_Rum ||--[257*] ezupattiraNTA[m] vITu [tañc]AvUr [jaya]- bhImataLi nakkan_ kAmAm[o]kikkuppag[ku] on_Rum ||--[258*] ezu[pa]t-tumUn_RA[m] vITu tiruvArUrpp[e]ri[ya]ta[Li]cceri [na]kkan_ p[o]n_n_Alikkup-pagku on_Rum ||--[259*] ezupattu[n]AlAm [vI]Tu niyamattu nRpa-kEsariIzvarattu nakkan_ vIrazikhAma-
[28.] [Ni]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[260*] ezupattaiñcAm vITu pAmpuNi SrI-pUtiviNNakar nakkan_ ArUrkkuppagku on_Rum ||--[261*] ezupattARAm [vITu ta]laiyAlagkATTu [na]kkan_ vIra[p][o]kikku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||-- [262*] ezupattezAm vITu i[v]vUr nakkan_ pon_n_ampalattukkup-pagku on_Rum ||--[263*] ezu[pa]tteTTAm vITu pazaiyARRu [va]Ta-taLi nakkan_ orup[pa]n_aikku[ppag]ku [o]n_Rum ||--[264*] ezupatto-n_pa[t]Am vITu [ka]TampUrttiru[vi]Lagko[yi]l [nak]kan_ umaikkuppagku on_-[page 2-270] Rum ||--[265*] e[N]patAm [vI]Tu [k]AvirippUmpaT[Ta]n_attu nakkan_ ara[gka]ttukkuppagku o[n_]Rum ||--[266*] eNpatto[n_]RAm [vI]Tu am[pa]r [mu]tu[pa]ka[var]taLi [na]kkan_ peRRati[ru]vu[kku]p[pa]gku on_Rum [267*] e[N]pattiraNTAm vITu ti[ru]viTaima[ru]til na[kka]n_ [rA]ja-[rA]jikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[268*]


Third Section.



[1.] [e]NpattumUn_RA[m vITu] pAccil tiruvamalIzvarattu nakkan_ mUñcikkuppagku on_Ru[m] ||--[269*] eNpattunAlAm [vI]Tu ti[ru]vArUrpp[e]riyataLic-ceri nakkan_ poRk[ALik]kup[pa]gku on_Rum [||--] [270*] eNpat-taiñcAm vITu iv[vUr] ula[kI]zva[ra]ttu nakkan_ tik[ai]mA[Ni]kkattukkup-pag[ku on_Rum] ||--[271*] [e]N[pa]tt[A]RAm [vITu ampar] mutu[pa-ka]va[rtaLi] nakka[n_] ceyyapAtattukku[ppa]gku o[n_]Ru[m] ||--[272*] e[Npa]ttezAm [vI]Tu [vir]AlUr [na]kkan_ aiy[ALu]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[273*] eN[pa]tte[TT]Am vITu nAkapaTTan_at[tu] naTuviltaLic[ceri nakka]n_ [nam]pu[kamarik]ku[ppag]ku o[n_]Rum ||--[274*] eN[pa]tton_pa-tAm [vI]Tu k[o]mAkkam[bhI]zvarattu [na]kkan_ [a]rai[ya]ttukkuppagku on_- Rum ||--[275*] to[N]NURAm [vI]Tu [ti]ruvA[rU]rttiruma[N]TaLi [nak]kan_ nit[tag]k[ai]kku[p]pagku on_[Ru]m ||--[276*] toNNUR-Ron_RAm [vI]Tu parAntakaIzvarattu nakkan_ ciRiyaumaikkuppagku [o]n_- Ru[m ||--] [277*] t[o]NNURRiraNTAm vITu tañcAvUr jaya[bhI]ma- taLi [nak]kan_ kA[mA]m[okik]ku[p]pagku o[n_]Rum ||--[278*] toN-NURRumUn_RAm vITu ivvUrttañcaimAma[Ni]kko[yi]l na[k]kan_ [ti]ruvazaku-kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[279*] toNNURRunAlAm vITu tirukkoL-LampUtUr nakkan_ ceyyaco[zat]tu[kku]ppagku on_Rum ||--[280*] to[N]NURR[ai]ñcA[m] vITu kaTampUr nakkan_ tirukku[ra]vikkuppagku on_- Rum ||--[281*] vaTakkil taLicce[ri] vaTaciRaku talai[vI]Tu nAkapaT-[Ta]n_a[t]tut[ti]rukkAroNattu nakkan_ [irAmikkuppa]gku on_Rum ||-- [282*] iraNTAm vITu ittaLi nakkan_ kaRRaLikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [283*] [mUn_RA]m [vI]Tu [i]t[ta]-
[2.] [Li na]k[ka]n_ [kaNNa]t[tuk]kuppagku on_Rum ||--[284*] nAl[A]m vITu k[o]TTUrppañcava[n_]mahAdEviIzvara[ttu] nakkan_ u[t]tama[cu]ntarikkup-pagku on_[Rum] ||--[285*] [aiñcA]m vITu [a]n[taLi] ava[n_i]k[E-sa]riIzvara[ttu na]kka[n_ kuñ]ca[ramallikkuppag]ku on_Rum ||--[286*] ARAm vITu kaR[pakatA]n_ipura[t]tu nak[ka]n_ cey[ya]pAtattukkup[pagku on_]- Ru[m] ||--[287*] e[zAm vI]Tu ti[ru]vArU[r]pp[e]riyata[Li]cceri nak[ka]n_ [ci]Riya[ara]vattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[288*] eT[TA]m vITu pazaiyARRu [va]Ta[ta]Li nak[ka]n_ cIlacULAmaNikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [289*] [o]n_patAm [vI]Tu [v]e[LU]r [na]kka[n_] a[n_antikkuppa]g[ku] on_Rum [||--] [290*] pattAm vITu [p]Ampu[Ni]ttirup[pAtALi]I[zva]ra- [ttu na]kka[n_] poRkA[Li]kku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[291*] pa[tin_]o-n_RAm vITu uttamatAn_ipurattu [nakkan_] A[rA]amutu[k]ku[p]pagku on_Rum ||--[292*] pa[n_n_ira]NTA[m vI]Tu AyirattaLi nakkan_ ve[N]kAT-Tukku[p]pagku on_Rum ||--[293*] patin_[mU]n_RAm vITu ivvUr [na]k-kan_ p[o]Rkoyiltillaiazakikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[294*] [pa]tin_A-[lA]m vITu [ut]tamatAn_i[purat]tu [nakkan_ okkUri]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[page 2-271] [295*] [pati]n_aiñcAm vITu AyirattaLi na[k]kan_666acagkikkup[pa]gku on_Rum ||--[296*] patin_ARAm vITu ti[ruvArU]r arum[ozi]Izvara-ttu nakkan_ [puka]lo[kamANikka]ttu[k]kuppagku on_Rum ||--[297*] [pati]n_ezAm vITu i[vvU]rpp[e]riyata[Li]cceri nakkan_ t[e]va[Tikku]p-[pag]ku on_Rum ||--[298*] patin_eTTAm vITu koTTur[k]ku[Nava]- ti[I]zvarattu nakka[n_ kUt]tATikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[299*] pa[t-to]n_patAm [vI]Tu mahAd[E]vi[I]zvara[ttu] na[k]ka[n_]••••• [l]likkuppag[ku o]n_Rum ||--[300*] irupatAm vITu [ta]LiccAttagkuTi nakkan_ pAk[ka]rikkuppagku o[n_Ru]m ||--[301*] [irupat]-
[3.] [ton_]RAm vITu k[o]TTUrppañcavan_mahAdE[vi]Izvarattu [na]kkan_ e[ra]Na-te[vi]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[302*] irupa[tti]raN[T]Am [vI]Tu [vi]- T[ai]yapurattuttiruppukaziIzvara[ttu] na[kkan_ na]m[pinag]kaikkuppagku o[n_]- Rum [||--] [303*] [iru]pattu[mU]n_[RA]m [vI]Tu [ko]T[TU]r[ppa]ñca-va[n_]ma[h]AdE[vi]Izvarattu nakkan_ [cI]paT[TAlik]ku[ppagku on_]Rum ||-- [304*] iru[pattu]nAlAm [vI]Tu ittaLi nakkan_ kuñcaramal[li]kkuppagku o[n_]Ru[m] ||--[305*] [iru]pattaiñcAm vITu viTaiyapurattu[p]puka[zI- zva]ra[ttu] na[kka]n_ k[A]RAyilukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[306*] irupattA-RAm [vI]Tu tiru[vArUrp]p[eri]ya[taLic]ceri nakkan_ kAmuttirikku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[307*] irupattezAm [vI]Tu [na]ya[tIra]purattu [na]k[ka]n_ [ka]ri[yaa]ravattuk[ku]ppagku on_Rum ||--[308*] irupatteTTAm vITu ampa[r avan_inArA]ya[Na]vi[N]Na[ka]r nakkan_ na[mpi]yamaikkuppag[ku o]- n_Rum ||--[309*] irupatton_patAm vITu tiruvA[rU]rttirumaNTa[Li]I-zvarattu nakka[n_] karuvUrkkuppagku on_Rum ||--[310*] muppatAm [vI]Tu ampart[ti]ru[m]AkALa[t]tu nakkan_ cempon_n_ukkuppa[g]ku on_[Ru]m ||-- [311*] muppatto[n_RAm vI]Tu Ayiratta[Li] mal[lI]zvarattu nak[ka]n_ p[o]RceyyALukkuppagku [o]n_[Ru]m ||--[312*] muppatti[ra]NTAm vITu jana[nAtha]pura[t]tu [vi]krama[vi]jayaIzvarattu nakka[n_ paTTati]ru[vu]kkup-pagku on_Rum ||--[313*] muppattu[mU]n_[RA]m [vI]Tu [ti]ruviTaima-[ruti]l [nakkan_] veNkATTukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[314*] muppattu-[n]AlAm vITu arapurattu [nika]Lag[ki]I[zvarattu nakkan_] muru[g]kaikkuppa-gku on_Rum ||--[315*] muppattaiñcAm [vI]Tu Ayiratta[Li nak]ka[n_] oR[RiyUrkkuppa]gku on_Rum [316*]
[4.] [mu]ppatt[A]RAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ [ATal]azakikku[p]pagku on_Rum ||-- [317*] muppattezAm vITu i[v]vUr nakkan_ ku[mAra]Ti[k]kuppagku on_- Rum ||--[318*] muppatteTTAm vITu tiruvetikuTi na[k]kan_ nag[k]A-[Li]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[319*] muppatton_[pa]tAm vITu [pa]r[An]- ta[ka]Izvarattu [nakka]n_ [ti]ripu[van_amA]t[e]vikku[ppa]g[ku on_Rum] [320*] [nAR]patAm vITu [A]RRu[ttaLi nakka]n_ irAmikkuppagku on_Ru[m] ||-- [321*] nARpatton_RAm vITu [ni]R[aima]tiIzvarattu [na]kkan_ cIruTaik[ka]- zalukkup[pa]gku on_[Rum] [322*] [nAR]pa[t]tira[N]T[Am] vITu [ti]ruc-coRRuttuRai nakkan_ maR[aikkA]T[Tuk]ku[ppa]gku [on_Rum] [323*] [nA]Rpat[tumUn_RA]m [vI]Tu tirukkoLLam[pUtU]r nakkan_ umai[k]kup[pa]gku [on_]Rum ||--[324*] nAR[pa]t[tu]nAlAm [vI]Tu [na]n_n_ila[t]tu[t]ti[ru]- va[malI]zvarattu nakkan_ ilavattukkuppagku [o]n_[Ru]m [||--] [325*] [nA-[page ]Rpatt]aiñc[Am vI]Tu [iv]vU[r]ttirumeRRaLi nakka[n_ oRRiyU]rkkuppagku [o]n_Rum ||--[326*] nARpattARAm vITu ti[ru]va[ma]lIzvarattu nakka[n_ c]ozamAte[vik]kuppagku on_Rum ||--[327*] [n]ARpattezAm vITu [ni-yamattu Ayirat]ta[Li] nakkan_ ATavall[ALu]kku[ppa]gku on_[Rum] [328*] [nARpatteT]TAm vITu i[vvUr can]ti[ra]malliIzvara[ttu na]k[ka]n_ na[m]pi-[yamaikkup]pagku o[n_Rum] ||--[329*] [n]ARpatto[n_]patAm [vITu pa]z[ai]yARRu [arai]y[eru]m[An]ta[Li] na[k]kan_ [amu]tattukku[p]pagku on_[Rum] [330*] [aimpatA]m [vITu ampar] mutu[pakavartaLi nak]kan_ cI-tevikkuppa[g]ku on_Rum ||--[331*] [ai]mpatton_RAm vITu pazai[y]A-RRutten_taLi nakkan_ piTTi[kku]ppagku on_[Rum] ||--[332*] [aim-pat]ti[raNTA]m [vITu ivvUr va]Ta[taLi na]kkan_ i[rAmik]kuppag[ku o-n_Rum] [333*] [aimpat]tu[mU]n_RAm vITu
[5.] [i]ttaLi nakkan_ [ci]gkaTikkuppag[ku on_]Rum ||--[334*] aimpattunAlAm vITu itta[Li na]kkan_ [cI]lacULAma[Ni]kkuppag[ku o]n_Ru[m] ||--[335*] [aimpa]t[tai]ñcAm vITu ivvUrccagkIzvarattu nakkan_ koyilukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[336*] aimpatt[A]RAm vITu ivvUr muLLU[r]na[k]kan_ta[Li nakkan_ ma]laiya[mAn_uk]kuppa[gku] o[n_Rum] [337*] [aimpa]t[te]z[Am vI]Tu [avan_in]Ar[A]ya[Na]purattu nakkan_ ai[yA]RRu[k]kuppagku o[n_]Rum ||-- [338*] aimpa[t]t[e]TTAm vITu tirun[e]ttAnattu nakka[n_] na[k]kat[tuk-kuppagku on_Ru]m ||--[339*] aimpatton_pa[t]Am [vI]Tu [tirut]- tegkU[r na]k[kan_ pe]RRa[maikkuppagku on_Rum] [340*] [aRupa]tAm vITu nan_n_ilattu[t]tiruvamalIzvarattu nak[kan_ pazippili]k[ku]ppagku on_Rum ||-- [341*] a[Ru]pa[tto]n_RAm vI[Tu ti]ru[vA]rU[r u]la[kI]zvarattu nakkan_ [pa]TTAlikku[ppagku on_Rum] [342*] [aRupa]t[tiraNT]Am [vITu ta]ñcAvU[r] eriyUrnATTutta[Li] nak[ka]n_ man_[Ra]muTaiyALukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[343*] aRupattumUn_RAm vITu ve[LUr] na[k]kan_ ku[p]paik[ku]p-[pa]gku o[n_Ru]m ||--[344*] a[Ru]pa[t]tunA[lAm] vITu [pa]zuvUr[ppa]- kaivi[TaiIzvara]ttu na[k]kan_Ati[t]tik[kuppagku] on_Rum ||--[345*] [a]Rupa[t]t[ai]ñcAm vI[Tu] ni[yamat]tu arikula[kEsa]riIzvarattu [nak]- kan_ nakka[ttukkuppag]ku on_Rum ||--[346*] [aRu]pa[t]tA[RAm] vITu tiruvArUr[pperiya]ta[Lic]ce[ri nakkan_ vi]llava[n_mAtevikkuppa]gku on_- Rum ||--[347*] aRupattezAm vITu ampar mutupakavartaLi nakkan_ eTuttapAtattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[348*] a[Ru]pat[te]TTA[m vI]Tu [kaTa]m[pU]r [nantI]zva[rattu] nakkan_ pUmik[kup]pa[gku on_Rum] [349*] [aRupatt]on_[pat]Am [vI]Tu tiru-
[6.] [vaiyAR]Ru [nak]kan_ tiru[vaTi]kaLukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[350*] [e]zu-patAm vITu tañcAvUr [brahma]kuT[Tattu] nakkan_ tUtu[vi]kku[p]pagku o[n_- Ru]m ||--[351*] ezupatton_RAm vITu [kañ]c[ARa]nakara[ttu nak]kan_ mazalaiccilampuk[ku]ppagku o[n_]Rum ||--[352*] ezupattira[N]T[A]m vITu [pa]zuvUr ava[niya]mata[Rpapu]ra[t]tu [na]k[kan_ pe]R[Ratiruvuk]kup[pa]g[ku on_- Rum] ||--[353*] [ezu]pat[tumUn_RAm vI]Tu o[l]okama[h]AdEviIzva-rattu nakkan_ [puka]lokam[ANi]kkat[tu]k[kuppag]ku on_Rum ||--[354*] ezupattunAlAm vITu pAmpu[Ni SrIpU]tivi[NNa]kar [na]kka[n_] cun[ta]rikku-ppagku on_Rum ||--[355*] [e]zupatt[aiñ]cAm [vITu n]AkapaT[Tan_a-ttuttirukkAroNat]tu nakkan_ mAtevi[k]kuppag[ku] o[n_]Rum ||--[356*] ezupattA[RAm] vITu ki[L]LikuTi [na]kka[n_] pon_n_ampalattukkuppagku on_-[page 2-273]Rum ||--[357*] ezu[pattez]Am vITu [tiru]vi[Taimaruti]l na[kka]n_ mu•kka[{??}]•[kkup]pagku on_Rum ||--[358*] ezupatteTTAm vITu tiruvArUrpperiyataLicceri nakka[n_] vempikkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [359*] e[zu]patto[n_]pa[tA]m [vI]Tu tiruvi[Taima]ru[til nak]kan_ [pukalo]kamANikkattukkuppag[ku on_Ru]m ||--[360*] e[N]patA[m vITu i]vvUr nakkan_ k[A]r[ai]k[kA]lukku[ppa]g[ku o]n_Ru[m] ||--[361*] e[N]pa[t]ton_[RAm] vITu [niya]mattu ariku[lakE]sa[riIzva]rattu [na]k-kan_ vIracozikku[p]pagku o[n_Rum] [362*] [eNpattiraN]TA[m vITu k]A[vi]rip[pUmpaTTa]n_attu nakka[n_] mUt[tA]Lukkuppag[ku] on_Rum ||-- [363*] e[N]pattumUn_RAm vITu niyamattu arikulakEsariI[zva]ra[ttu nakkan_ cantira]c[e]ka[ri]kkuppa[g]ku o[n_Rum] ||--[364*] e[Npa]ttu-[nA]lAm [vITu iv]vUr A[yirattaLi na]kkan_ pUmik[ku]-
[7.] [ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[365*] e[N]patt[aiñ]cAm vITu kiL[Li]kuTi nakkan_ [cun]ta[ri]k[kup]pa[g]ku on_Rum ||--[366*] eNpa[ttARA]m vITu miRai[yil] nakka[n_] aiyARRuk[kup]pagku o[n_]Rum ||--[367*] e[N]pattezAm vITu [ka]TampUr na[ntI]zvarattu nakkan_ aiyARRukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[368*] [eN]pa[t]te[TTA][m*] [vITu tiru]vai[yARRu nakkan_ arum]ozi[kku]ppagku [on_Ru]m ||--[369*] [eN]patton_- [pa]tAm vITu667komAkka[mbhI]zvarattu nakka[n_] caNTaikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[370*] to[NNU]RAm vITu tañcAvUr [brahma]kuTTattu nak[ka]n_ nallUrkku[p]pagku on_Rum [||--] [371*] [toNNURRon_RA]m vITu parAntakaIzva[rattu na]kkan_ [pa]rAnterumAn_ukku[p]pa[gku] o[n_]Rum ||-- [372*] to[N]NURRira[N]TAm vITu tiruppazan_attu nakka[n_ kaNa]va-ti[k]kuppagku o[n_]Ru[m] [373*] [toNNUR]RumU[n_]RAm vI[Tu pAm-puNit]tirup[pA]tA[Li]Izvarattu nakkan_ kuTitAgkikkuppa[g]ku on_Ru[m ||--] [374*] to[N]NU[R]RunAlAm vITu tirukkoL[LampUtUr nakka]n_ c[o]- za[tevikkup]pagku o[n_Rum] ||--[375*] [t]oNNURRaiñcAm [vITu kaTam]pUr [i]TT[A]cciI[zvarattu] nakkan_ tU[g]kAn_aikkuppag[ku on_]Rum [||--] [376*] [t]o[N]NUR[RARAm] vITu tañcAvU[r] bra[hma]kuTTattu na[kkan_ p]eRRamaikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[377*] ••••• [talai-vITu]••••• [na]k[kan_]••••• kkuppagku o[n_Rum ||--] [378*] [iraN]TAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ nittacuntarikkuppag[ku] on_- [Rum] ||--[379*] [mU]n_RAm vITu [tirunettA]n_at[tu] na[k]kan_ [paT]- T[Alik]ku[ppa]gku [on_Ru]m ||--[380*] nAlAm [vI]Tu [arapurattu na]kka[n_] kA[r]oNattukku-
[8.] ppagku on_Rum ||--[381*] [a]ñcAm vITu Ayirat[taLi] nakkan_ [a]t-tan_a[p]p[o]n_n_ukkup[pa]gku [on_Ru]m ||--[382*] A[RA]m vITu an-taLi [avan_i]k[EsariI]zvarattu nakkan_ [mazalai]ccilampukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[383*] [e]zA[m] vITu ivvUr i[t]taLi nakkan_ [tikaimANi]k-kattukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[384*] eTTAm vITu ittaLi nakkan_ [ku]- lamA[Ni]kka[ttuk]ku[p]pagku on_Rum ||--[385*] on_patAm vITu miRai-yil [na]kkan_ [tA]yattukkuppagku on_Rum [||--] [386*] pattAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ aragka[t]tukkuppa[g]ku on_Rum ||--[387*] patin_on_- RAm vITu puRaiyAcceri nakkan_ [ce]yya[vA]y[maNik]ku[p]pa[gku] on_Ru[m] ||--[388*] [pan_n_i]raNTAm vITu [m]AteviIzvarattu nakkan_ p[o]-[page 2-274]n_malaikkuppagku on_Ru[m] ||--[389*] [pa]tin_mUn_RAm vITu [ti]ruve-tikuTi nak[ka]n_ p[on_]n_ampalat[tu]kkuppagku on_Rum ||--[390*] pa[tin_A]lA[m] vITu ta[laiyA]lagkATTu nakkan_ nampANTikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[391*] pati[n_aiñ]cAm vITu [ta]gkattArtaLi nakkan_ maNTaikkuppagku on_Rum ||--[392*] pa[ti]n_ARAm vITu maNNinakarattu na[k]ka[n_ nI]la-[ttu]kkup[pag]ku on_Rum ||--[393*] pati[n_ez]Am vITu [va]yalUr na[kka]n_ [pa]T[TAli]kkup[pa]gku on_Rum ||--[394*] [pa]tin_e[T]TAm vITu i[v]vUr nakka[n_ cu]Na[g]kaikkuppagku o[n_Rum] ||--[395*] patton_patAm vITu ivvUr nakkan_ umaikkuppagku on_[Ru]m ||-- [396*] i[ru]patAm vITu pazuvUr avan_ikE[sariIzvara]ttu nakkan_ po-Rk[ecik]ku[p]pagku o[n_]Rum ||--[397*] i[ru]pa[tto]n_[RA]m [vI]Tu ivvU[r]ppakaiviTai[Izvarattu na]k[ka]n_ vA[n_a]van_[m]Ate[vi]kkup[pa]-
[9.] gku on_Rum ||--[398*] irupattiraNTA[m] vITu i[v]vUr nakka[n_ ariyALu]k[ku]p[pa]gku [on_Ru]m [||--] [399*] [i]rupattumUn_[RAm vI]Tu [pa]ntaNanallUr [na]k[ka]n_ aRi[ñ]cikkup[pa]gku on_Rum ||--[400*] irupa[t]tu[n]A[l]Am vITu tiruvaiyA[R]Ru nakkan_ pU[vaNat]tukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[401*] irupattaiñcAm [vITu] k[o]T[TUrk]ku[Nava]tiI-zva[ra]ttu [na]kkan_ [pañ]ca[van_]mAte[vik]kuppagku on_Rum ||--§ [402*] naTTavañceyya [na]T[Tava]m on_Rukku668 araiyan_ cu[n]tara[c]ozan_A[n_a] mummaTi[co]za[ni]rttamArAyan_ukkuppagku iraNTum ||--[403*] meRpaTi on_Rukkukkuma[ra]n_ [vaTa]vA[yi]l[A]n_a mummaTic[o]za[nirttappe]rai[ya]n_u-[k]kuppa[g]ku iraNTum ||--[404*] meR[paTi] on_Rukku [vi]kki [pa]T-[T]Ala[kan_u]kku[p]pa[g]ku iraNTum ||--[405*] meRpaTi on_Rukku [a]rai[yar] abhimAn_atogkan_An_a arum[o][zinirttap]p[e]ra[yan_uk]ku[p]- pagku ira[N]Tum ||--[406*] meR[pa]Ti on_Rukku mallan_ iraTTai-[ya]n_ukkum [cit]ti[ra]n_ kecuvan_ukkum pagku iraNTum ||--[407*] meR-[pa]Ti on_Rukku araiyan_ maNañceriyAn_a vakaiyili[nirttapper]ai[yan_u]k-ku[ppa]gku i[raN]Tum ||--[408*] {??}••• [TapAT]Tu on_Rukkuk[ku-rA]van_ [vI]rac[ozan_A]n_a pañ[ca]van_mAte[vin]ATa[ka]ma[yya]n_ukkuppag[ku] on_Raraiyum ||--[409*] meRpa[Ti] on_Rukku ma[R]ai[kkATTukkaNavatiyAn_a] ti[ruve]LLaRaiccAkkaikkuppagku on_Raraiyum ||--[410*] meR[pa]Ti on_Rukku o[R]RiyUran_ cig[kan_ukkup]pa[gku] o[n_]Rarai[yum] ||--[411*] m[e]RpaTi on_Rukku oRRiyU[ran_ i]Lag[kAvan_u]kkuppa[gku] on_Raraiyum ||--[412*] [me]•[viyam on_Ruk]ku arai[ya]n_ rA[jA]-
[10.] SrIyan_A[n_a] nitta[vin_otav]A[dya]m[A]rAyan_u[kkup]pagku iraNTum ||--[413*] meRpaTi [on_]Rukku [a]raiyan_ ni[n_RanArA]ya[Na]n_u[k]kuppagku [iraN]- Tum ||--[414*] kA[n_ap]A[Ti] mUva[rk]ku mu[NTa]tA[ri] a[Nukkan_u]- kkup[pagku] nAlaraiyum ||--[415*] meRpaTi ira[N]Tu[k]ku Acca[n_] 669kIrttipUSa[Na]n_An_a aRiñcik[ai] kA[mara]pp[e]raiya[n_uk]kup[pag]ku [mUn_- Ru]m ||--[416*] va[gki]yam on_Ru[k]ku nika[ri]licozatteri[n]ta[u]Tanilai-kkutiraicce[va]karil nin_Rum [pu]kunta [tañ]cai ka[Nava]tik[ku]ppag[ku] o[n_- Ra]raiyum ||--[417*] m[e]RpaTi o[n_]Rukku[c]ciRutan_attu vaTukakkA[lava]ril ce[ruva]t[tavi]raiyan_uk[kuppag]ku o[n_]Raraiyum ||--[418*] meR[pa]Ti o[n_]Rukku rAje[ndra]da[sa]raiyan_ukkuppagku o[n_]Ra[raiyu]m ||--[419*]
[page 2-275] [pA]Taviyam on_RukkukkU[ttan_ bahu] •• [vi]Tagkan_ukkuppagku ira[N]- Tum ||--[420*] meRpa[Ti o]n_Ru[k]ku ar[aiya]n_ vAdyamArAyan_uk-kuppagku iraNTum ||--[421*] meRpaTi on_Rukku brahmakuTTan_ [ka]- NavatiyAn_a irumaTicozavAdyamArAyan_u[k]kuppagku iraNTum ||--[422*] meRpaTi on_Rukku poka[yan_ poriyila]n_An_a mummaTicozavAdyamArA[ya-n_u]kkup[pa]gku iraNTum ||--[423*] uTukkai [vAci]kka oruvan_ukku vI[ra]cozan_ viTa[gkan_A]n_a rA[ja]rA[ja]SrI[hasta]n_ukkuppagku on_Raraiyum ||--[424*] [m]e[R]pa[Ti] o[n_]Ru[kku]kkU[ttan_ A]dittan_An_a r[A]ja-rAjasahasra[b]Ahuvukku[p]pagku on_Rar[ai]yu[m] ||--[425*] vI[Nai] vAcip[pAr] i[ruva]rkku [subra]hmaNyan [kU]ttan_An_a ce[mpiyan_]vI[Nai]- A[di]ttan_u[k]kuppa[g]ku mUn_Ra[r]aiyum ||--[426*] ivan_ cettam[ai-yil] iva[n_] ma[kaLaikkoN]Ta i[van_]••• [pa]•670 .
[11.] makan_ a[raiya]n_ 671[za]tAzivan_ukkukkANiyAka[vu]m ||--[427*] Ari[ya]m [p]ATuvAr mUvar[k]ku [a]r[ai]yan_ ampalanAta[n] An_a c[e]m[piyan_]vAdya- mArAyan_ukkuppagku [n]Alaraiyum ||--[428*] tamiz [pA]Ta o[ru]van_uk-ku[ppaTT]Alaka[n_ kA]mara[pp]e[r]ai[yan_u]kkuppag[ku] on_[Ra]r[aiyu]m ||-- [429*] meRpaTi on_Rukku [a]mu[tan_ k]A[Li]kku[ppa]gku o[n_]Rar[ai]yum ||--[430*] meRpaTi on_Rukku [v]ANarAci kUt[ta]n_ukkuppagku on_Rarai-yum ||--[431*] meRpaTi on_Rukku [araiya]n_ cURRikku[p]pagku [o]n_Raraiyum ||--[432*] koTTimattaLam on_Rukku gAndharvvadAsan_ukku[p-pa]gku on_Rum ||--[433*] meRpaTi on_Rukku gAndharvva[tuR]aikkavAlik-kuppagku on_Rum ||--[434*] [mu]t[ti]raiccagku on_RU[tat]ta[yi]lan_ [vi]kkiyaNNan_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[435*] meRpaTi o[n_Ruk]ku mum-[ma]Ti[c]ozatteri[nta]A[n_aip]pAkaril [cU]RRi nAtan_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[436*] meRpaTi on_Rukku [tañc]AvUr eriyUrnATTu[t]taLi uvaic-can_ p[o]RkA[Li] toNTayan_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[437*] pakka-vAdyar azaki[ya]cozatterintavalagk[ai]veLaikkARa[ril aiyARan_ a]ntarik-kuppagku mu[k]kAlum ||--[438*] meRpaTi kSatri[ya]zikhAmaNitterin-tavalagkaive[Lai]k[kA]Raril catti ArUrkkuppagku mukkAlum ||--[439*] meRpaTi nittavin_otava[La]nATTu [AvU]r[k]kURRa[t]tu[k]karukA[vU]r[p]pAtazi- va[n_] Accan_ piccan_ukkuppagku muk[kA]lum ||--[440*] meRpaTi 672zatrubhujaG[ka]tt[e]ri[n]ta[va]lagkaive[Lai]kkA[Ra]ril catti p[o][n_]n_a-n_ukkuppag[ku] mu[k]kA[lu]m ||--[441*] meRpa[Ti] vI[ra]coza[a]Nu-kkaril kAman_ [ai]yARa[n_u]kkuppagku mukkA[lu]m ||--[442*] [g]A-
[12.] ndharvvaril ezupattaiyva[n_A]l [v]Aykkum pagku mukkAlum ||--[443*] rAja- [kaN]Tiyavatterin[ta]valagkaiv[eLai]kkARaril [pa]TTAlakan_ a[m]palattukkup-pagku mu[k]kAlum ||--[444*] gA[ndharvvari]l kupp[ai] tirumaNañcerik-kuppagku mukk[A]lum ||--[445*] tañcAvUr brahmakuTTat[tu] uvaic-can_ [ai]yARa[n_ kaNTa]rAccan_u[kku]ppagku mukkAlum ||--[446*] rAjarAjatteri[n]tavala[g]kai[ve]Lai[k*]kARaril varakuNan_ cIrALan_u[k]kup[pa]- gku mukkAlum ||--[447*] [par]A[n]ta[ka]kko[g]kavALil [kI]rtti nAtan_u-[k]kuppagku mu[kk]Alum ||--[448*] ivan_ cettamai[yi]l i[va]n_ tampi kIr[t]ti kiLaitAgkikkukkANiyA[kavu]m ||--[449*] aridurggalagkan_atteri[n-ta]valagkai[v]e[Lai]k[k]ARa[ri]l nURReN[ma]n_ [cU]RRi[kku]ppagku mukk[A]- lum ||--[450*] ivan_ cettam[aiyi]l [i]va[n_] tampi nURRe[Nman_]
[page 2-276] . [La]•[k]kuk[kA]NiyAkavum ||--[451*] mU[r*]ttavikramAbhara[Na]tte-[ri]ntavala[g]k[ai]veLaikkARaril magka[lava]n_ mANikkuppagku [mu]kkAlum ||-- [452*] ippaTaitta[N]Tan_ kampan_ukkup[pa]gku mu[k]kAlum ||--[453*] ippaT[ai] ArUr tevan_uk[ku]p[pa]g[ku] muk[kAlu]m ||--[454*] mum-maTicozatterintapari[k]kARaril kaN[Ti] kA[Li]kku[p]pagku mukkAlum ||-- [455*] ira[Namukha]bhImatte[ri]nta[vala]gkaiv[eLai]kkARa[ri]l aTi[ka]L ceTTikkuppagku [muk]kAlum ||--[456*] nittavi[n_otava]LanATTu A[vU]rk-kURRattukkUn_arkaLmun_n_iyUr uvaiccan_ [ka]Lari Accan_u[k]kuppag[ku] mu[k-kAlu]m ||--[457*] [tañ]cAvUrttañcai[mA]ma[Nikkoyi]l vIra[c]o[za-aNu]kkan_ pa[rA]nta[ka]n_ vIman_ukkup[pa]gku mukkAlum ||--[458*] iv[vUr jaya]bhImataLi [vI]racozaa[Nu]kka[n_ cu]nta-
[13.] ran_ kAlakAlan_u[k]kuppag[ku] muk[k]Alum ||--[459*] i[t]taLi vIrac[oza]- a[Nu]kkan_ [pi]ca[gka]n_ cIrA[Lan_u]kkuppagku mukkAlum ||--[460*] itta[Li vIra]c[o]zaaNukkan_ tevan_ cegku[La]van_ukkuppagku [mu]kkAlum ||--[461*] vikramAbhara[Na]tterintavalagk[ai]v[e]LaikkARaril irAman_ kam-[pa]n_ukku[p]pagku mukkA[lum] ||--[462*] [iLai]yarAjarA[ja]tterintavala-gkaiv[eLaikk]ARaril Accan_ A[Ta]va[l]lAn_ukkuppagku mu[kk]Alum ||-- [463*] rAjakaNTIyavatterintavalagk[ai]veLaikkARaril ut[ta]man_ kUtta-n_ukkuppagku mukkAlum ||--[464*] tiruvA[yk]kezvi on_Rukkukkumaran_ jayamAn_a[n_A]n_a mumma[Ti]cozakkaTikaimArA[ya]n_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||-- [465*] meRpaTi on_Rukkukkumara[n_] a[rum]oziyAn_a rAjar[A]jak[ka]Tikai-mArA[ya]n_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[466*] meR[paTi on_Ruk]ku rAja-[k]E[sa]ri kotaNTarAman_An_a jayagkoNTacozakkaTikaimArA[ya]n_ukkup[pa]gku on_Ru[m] ||--[467*] meRpaTi on_Rukku Accan_ ma[ti]ki[zava]n_A[n_a] aza-[kiya]cozakkaTikaimArA[ya]n_ukku[ppa]gku on_Rum ||--[468*] meRpaTi on_Rukku [p]ANDyaku[l]AzanivaLa[nA]TTu mIycegkiLinATTu vagkAramAn_a [ti]runArAyaNaccaturvvEdimaGgalattu mokili[ya]n_ coman_ parA[n]t[erum]An_uk-kup[pa]gku on_Ru[m] ||--[469*] taLicceripp[e]NTu[ka]Lukkum gAndharvvi- ka[Lu]kkum nAyakañcey[ya] cAvUr parañc[o]tikku[ppagku] ira[N]Tum ||-- [470*] meRpa[Ti] k[o][vindan c]oman_Ata[n_u]kku[ppa]gku iraNTu[m] ||-- [471*] kaNakku nittavin_[o]ta[va]LanATTu [vIrac]ozavaLanATTuccem[pa]gku-
[14.] T[aiyAn tan_n_i]cc[ai] caturavi[Tag]kan_ukkuppagku [iraN]Tum ||--[472*] [i]va[n_u]k[ku]kkIzkka[Na]kku ezutuvA[r] iru[var]kkupperARpagku mukk[A-lAkappa]gku on_Raraiyu[m] ||--[473*] pANDyakulAzanivaLanATTu mIy-cegkiLi[n]ATTukkaTai[yk]ku[Taiy]A[n_] mAt[evan_] ci[va]lo[ka]cu[n]taran_uk-kup[pa]gku ira[N]Tum ||--[474*] ivan_ukkuk[kI]zkka[Nak]ku ezutuvAr iru[va]rkkupperARpagku mukkAlAka[ppa]gku o[n_]Raraiyum ||--[475*] kSatriyazikhAmaNivaLanATTuttiruvArUr[k]kUR[Ra]ttukkIzkkuTaiyAn_ na[k]ka[n_] perumAn_ukkuppagku ira[N]Tum ||--[476*] ivan_ukkukkIzkka[Na]kku e[zu]- tuvAr i[ru]varkkupp[e]rARpagku mukkAlAkappagku on_Raraiyum ||--[477*] nittavin_otavaLa[n]ATTu nallUr[n]ATTu mAgkuTaiyAn_ aiyARan_ poRcuva-ran_ukkup[pa]gku iraNTum ||--[478*] i[van_uk]kukkI[z]k[kaNakku] ezu-tuvAr iruvarkkupperA[Rpag]ku mukk[A]lAkappagku [o]n_Raraiyum ||-- [479*] [uv]aiccukku uL[paTu]m nittavin_otavaLanATTu nallUr[n]ATTu nallUrAkiya pañca[va]n_mahAdEviccaturvvEdimaGgalattu ai[ya]n_ po[y]yilikkut-tan_n_eRRam AL patin_oruvar[k]kupperA[R]pagku araiyAkappagku aiñcarai-yum ||--[480*] meRpaTi [ca]kaTaikoTTikaLil [t]Amotiran_ ceT-[page 2-277]Tikkut[tan_]n_eRRam AL pa[ti]n_o[ru]varkkupperAR[pa]gku ar[aiyA]ka[p]- pa[g]ku añcaraiyum ||--[481*] meRpaTikku uLpaTum cakaTaikoTTi-ka[Lil]•zi a[ra]gkattukkuttan_n_eRRam AL pa[ti]n_oruvarkkupperAR-
[15.] [pag]ku araiy[Aka]ppa[g]ku aiñcaraiyum ||--[482*] meRpaTikku uL[pa-Tu]m caka[TaikoTTi]ka[Li]l cAt[ta]n_ [a]mpalattukkuttan_n_e[R]Ram AL patin_oru[va]rkkup[p]erARpagku araiyAkappagku aiñcaraiyum ||--[483*] meRpaTikku uLpaTum cakaTaikoTTika[Li]l catti i[raNa]k[o]Lan_ukkuttan_- n_eRRam AL patin_o[ru]va[r]kkupp[e]rARpagku araiyAkappagku aiñca-raiyum ||--[484*] meRpaTikku uLpaTuntaTi mA[Ru]m a[rai]yan_ utai-[yam]AttA[N]Tan_ukkuttan_n_eRRam AL patin_o[ru]varkkupp[er]AR[pag]ku araiyAkappagku ai[ñ]caraiyum ||--Aka ivarkaLe pA[ta]vakkANi peRavum Aka i[ppaTi kA]Ni [pe]RRup[paNi] ceyyavum ||--[485*] [ti]rup-paLLitt[o]gkal piTikkum ALukku uLpaTuvAn_ [oru]van_ukkuppagku on_- Rum ||--AL patin_markkupperARpagku eTTu mA[vu]m Aka [u]Tai-y[A*]n_ tiruvicalUrAn_a mum[maTic]oza[t]t[o]g[ka]Rperaiya[n_u]kku[m] kuppa[Ti] van_n_iyAn_a kSatriyazikhAma[Nit]t[o]g[ka]Rp[e]raiya[n_u]kku[mAkap]- pagku aiñcum ||--[486*] viLakkuTaiyArkaLukku uLpaTuvAn_ oruvan_uk-kuppagku on_Rum ||--AL ezin_u[k]kupper[A]Rpagku araiyAkap[pa]gku mUn_Raraiyum A[kap]pu[va]n_ic[e]karan_ kaR[pa]kamAn_a pañcavan_perai[ya]n_ukkuppa-gku nAlaraiyum ||--[487*] nI[r]tteLiyAn_ nAlvarkku[p]perAR-pagku araiy[A]ka meR[paTiy]An_ukkuppagku iraNTum ||--[488*] can_- n_AliyaL i[ru]varkku[pp]erAR[pa]gku mukkAlAka meRpaTiyAn_ukkuppagku on_- Raraiyum ||--[489*] tirumaT[ai]ppaLLikku[cava]rkku u[L]paTuvAn_ oru-van_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--
[16.] [AL] pa[ti]n_mar[k]kupper[A]Rpagku [a]raiyumAka cUrazikhAmaNipperunt[eru-vil] kuca[va]r[k]kuppagku ARum ||--[490*] vaNNattArkaL i[ru]vark-kupperARpagku on_RAka [i]tteruvil Ira[g]koLLikaLukkup[pa]gku iraN-[Tu]m ||--[491*] [k]Avitimai [c]eyya o[ru]van_ukku [ar]aiya[n_] ma[Na]- lilig[ka]n_An_a cem[piya]n_p[e]rug[k]A[vi]tikkuppagku araiyum ||--[492*] meRpaTi on_Ru[k]ku Accan_ tiruvegkaTa[m]An_a rAjarAjapperugk[Avi]ti[k-ku]ppagku araiyum ||--[493*] [n]A[vica]ñce[y]ya i[ru]varkku c[e]ya-[ta]ran_ nettAn_an_ An_a rAjarAjapp[e]ru[n]Avican_ukkuppag[ku] on_Rum ||--[494*] tiru oruvan_ukku[m kI]zAL i[ra]NTukkum tuNaiyan_ [A]tittan_A[n_a] cempiyan_k[o]RRappe[ru]gkaNikkuppa[g]ku iraNTum ||-- [495*] me[R]paTi oruvan_ukkum [kI]zAL ira[N]Tukkum [pa]rAntakan_ [p]ANDyakulAzani An_a rAjarAjagaNi[t]AdhirA[jan_u]kkuppagku ira[NTu]m ||-- [496*] k[oli]n_amai [c]ey[vA]r iru[va]rkku [a]r[aiya]n_ pava[ru]t-[tira]n_An_a pañca[va]n_magka[lap]pe[raiyan_u]kku[ppagku] mUn_Rum ||--[497*] ampaTTan_ kon_ caTa[g]kavi[y]An_a rAjarAjaprayO[ga]taraiyan_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[498*] tayyAn_ oruvan_ukkuttevan_ kavAli[yA]n_a [vI]ra-cozapp[e]runta[y]pAn_ukkuppag[ku] o[n_]Rum ||--[499*] meRpaTi on_- Rukku cippan_ mazapATiyAn_a keraLAntakapperu[ntayy]An_ukku673[p]pagku on_- Rum ||--[500*] ra[tna]t[ta]yyAn_ Accan_ karunti[T]Taikkup[pa]gku on_Ra-raiyum ||--[501*] 674[ka]n_n_An_ oruvan_ukku iTaikkarai[kAriyA]n_a kSatri-yazikhAmaNi[p]perug[ka]n_n_An_ukkuppagku on_Rum ||--[502*]
[page 2-278]
[17.] taccAcA[ryyam o]n_Rukkuppa[g]ku [o]n_[Rar]ai[yu]m AL iraNTukkuppa[gku] o[n_Rar]aiyum ||--Aka vIracozan_ kuñcaramallan_A[n_a] rAjarAjapperuntac-can_ukkuppagku mUn_Rum ||--[503*] taccu on_Rukkukku[Na]van_ maturAnta-[kan_A]n_a nittavin_otappe[ru]ntaccan_ukkuppa[gku muk]kA[lu]m ||--[504*] meRpaTi on_Rukku i[la]tti caTaiyan_An_a [kaN]TarAtittapperu[nta]ccan_uk-kuppagku mukkAlu[m] ||--[505*] pA[Nan_] uttaman_ cU[R]Riy[An_a] a[ri]kulakEsari[ccA]kk[ai]kkuppagku on_Raraiyum ||--[506*] meRpaTi aiyARan_ aRiñcikkuppagku [o]n_Raraiyum ||--[507*] meRpaTi a[pa]rA-yitan_ [va]TavAyilAn_a palla[van_]cAkkaikkuppagku on_Raraiyum ||--[508*] meRpaTi va[TuvUra]Riñcikku[p]pagku on_Raraiyum ||--[509*] ka[N]kA[Ni]- ttaTTAn_mai ceyya orALi[TTuppaNi] cey[vi]t[tu]kko[LLa]ppeRuv[A-n_Aka] uTaiyAr SrIrAja[rAja]d[E]var [ci]Rutan_at[tu]k[ka]N[kANitta]TTAn_ kUttan_ [kaNavati]yAn_a [kSatri]yazikhAmaNip[p]eru[n]taTTAn_u[k]kuppagku on_Ru ||--[510*]


TRANSLATION.



1. Hail ! Prosperity ! Until the twenty-ninth year (of the reign) of Kō-Rājakēsarivar-man, alias Śrī-Rājarājadēva, who, etc.,675--the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva had (1) given (a number of) Nivandakkāṟar676 as Nivandakkāṟar of the lord of the Śrī-Rājarājēśvara (temple), and (2) transferred (a number of) temple women677 from (other) temple establishments678 of the Chōḷa country (Śōṛa-maṇḍalam) as temple women of the lord of the Śrī-Rājarājēśvara (temple). To (these persons) shares (paṅgu) were allotted as allowance (nibandha). (The value) of each share (which consisted of the produce) of (one) vēli of land, was to be one hundred kalam of paddy, (measured) by the marakkāl called (after) Āḍavallāṉ, which is equal to a rājakēsari. Instead of those among these shareholders, who would die or emigrate, the nearest relations of such persons were to receive that allowance (kāṇi) and to do the work. If the nearest relations were not qualified themselves, (they) were to select (other) qualified persons, to let (these) do the work, and to receive (the allowance). If there were no near relations, the (other) incumbents of such appointments679 were to select qualified persons from those fit for such appointments, and the person selected was to receive the allowance. Accordingly, (the names of these persons) were engraved on stone, as the lord Śrī-Rājarājadēva had been pleased to order.
2. The temple women (were the following):--
3. To [Ś]ē[ra]maṅ[gai], a girl680 (who has been transferred from the establishment of the temple) of Lōkamahādēvi-Īśvara at Tiruvaiyāṟu,681 (and who resides in) the first house of the southern row (śiṟagu) of the temple street on the south (of the temple), one share.
[page 2-279]
4. To [Ira]ṇamugarā[mi], a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the second house, one share.
5. To Udāram, a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the third house, one share.
6. To [Pa]ṭṭāli,682 a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the fourth house, one share.
7. To Eḍutta[pādam],683 a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the fifth house, one share.
8. To Śōṛakulasundari, a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the sixth house, one share.
9. To Ēkavīri, a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the seventh house, one share.
10. To Rāja[k]ēsari, a girl of the Tiru[kkārōṇam] (temple) at Nāgapaṭṭaṉam,684 (who resides in) the eighth house, one share.

12. To Periya-Tēśichchi, a girl of the same temple, (who resides in) the tenth house, one share.
13. To Vichchādiri (i.e., Vidyādharī), a girl of the Tirukkārōṇam (temple) in the same village, (who resides in) the eleventh house, one share.

348. To Eḍuttapādam, a girl of the Mudubagavartaḷi (temple) at Ambar, (who resides in) the sixty-seventh house, one share.
349. To Pūmi (i.e., Bhūmi), a girl of the [Nandī]śvara (temple) at Kaḍambūr, (who resides in) the sixty-eighth house, one share.
350. To Tiruvaḍigaḷ, a girl of Tiruvaiyāṟu, (who resides in) the sixty-ninth house, one share.
351. To Tūdu[vi], a girl of the [Brahma]kuṭṭam (temple) at Tañjāvūr, (who resides in) the seventieth house, one share.
352. To Maṛalaichchilambu, a girl of [Kañ]j[āṟa]nagaram, (who resides in) the seventy-first house, one share.
353. To [Pe]ṟ[ṟatiru], a girl of Avaniyamada[ṟpapu]ram, (a quarter) of Paṛuvūr, (who resides in) the seventy-second house, one share.
354. To [Puga]lōgamāṇikkam, a girl of the Lōkamahādēvi-Īśvara (temple), (who resides in) the seventy-third house, one share.
355. To Sundari, a girl of the Śrīpūdi-Viṇṇagar (temple) at Pāmbuṇi, (who resides in) the seventy-fourth house, one share.
356. To Mādēvi, a girl of the [Tirukkārōṇam] (temple) at Nāgapaṭṭaṉam, (who resides in) the seventy-fifth house, one share.
357. To Poṉṉambalam, a girl of Kiḷḷiguḍi, (who resides in) the seventy-sixth house, one share.
358. To••••• , a girl of Tiruviḍaimarudil, (who resides in) the seventy-seventh house, one share.
359. To Vēmbi, a girl of Periyataḷichchēri, (a quarter) of Tiruvārūr, (who resides in) the seventy-eighth house, one share.
360. To [Pugalō]gamāṇikkam, a girl of Tiruviḍaimarudil, (who resides in) the seventy-ninth house, one share.
361. To K[ār]aik[kā]l,724 a girl of the same village, (who resides in) the eightieth house, one share.
362. To Vīra-Śōṛ, a girl of the Arikulakēsari-Īśvara (temple) at Niyamam, (who resides in) the eighty-first house, one share.
[page 2-296]
363. To Mūt[tā]ḷ, a girl of [K]āvirippūmbaṭṭaṉam, (who resides in) the eighty-second house, one share.
364. To [Śandiraś]ēga[ri],725 a girl of the Arikulakēsari-Īśvara (temple) at Niyamam, (who resides in) the eighty-third house, one share.
365. To Pūmi, a girl of Ā[yirattaḷi], (a quarter) of the same village, (who resides in) the eighty-fourth house, one share.
366. To [Sun]da[ri], a girl of Kiḷḷiguḍi, (who resides in) the eighty-fifth house, one share.
367. To Aiyāṟu, a girl of Miṟaiyil, (who resides in) the eighty-sixth house, one share.
368. To Aiyāṟu, a girl of the Na[ndī]śvara (temple) at Kaḍambūr, (who resides in) the eighty-seventh house, one share.
369. To [Arumo]ṛ, a girl of [Tiru]vai[yāṟu], (who resides in) the eighty-eighth house, one share.
370. To Śaṇḍai, a girl of the Kōmākka[mbhī]śvara (temple), (who resides in) the eighty-ninth house, one share.
371. To Nallūr, a girl of the [Brahma]kuṭṭam (temple) at Tañjāvūr, (who resides in) the ninetieth house, one share.
372. To Parānderumāṉ, a girl of the Parāntaka-Īśvara (temple), (who resides in) the ninety-first house, one share.
373. To [Kaṇa]vadi, a girl of Tiruppaṛaṉam, (who resides in) the ninety-second house, one share.
374. To Kuḍitāṅgi, a girl of the Tirup[pā]dā[ḷi]-Īśvara (temple) at [Pāmbuṇi], (who resides in) the ninety-third house, one share.
375. To Śōṛa[dēvi], a girl of Tirukkoḷḷambūdūr, (who resides in) the ninety-fourth house, one share.
376. To Tū[ṅ]gāṉai, a girl of the Iṭṭāchchi-Īśvara (temple) at Kaḍambūr, (who resides in) the ninety-fifth house, one share.
377. To Peṟṟamai, a girl of the Bra[hma]kuṭṭam (temple) at Tañjāvūr, (who resides in) the ninety-sixth house, one share.

379. To Nittasundari, a girl of the same village, (who resides in) the second house, one share.

[page 2-297]
386. To [Tā]yam, a girl of Miṟaiyil, (who resides in) the ninth house, one share.
